38722566.review:
The gameplay videos don't do the game justice. What is Chronicon? It's a top-down action RPG which borrows from many other popular games in the genre (primarily Diablo II & III), while offering a very laid-back experience which you can enjoy at your own pace.

The game currently offers 4 classes, and 5 difficulty settings. The primary archetypes are covered, don't worry.

The difficulty settings aren't just for fluff, they increase drop-rate bonuses at the risk of harder enemies as well as reduced player resistances. As an added perk, the best gear can only be obtained from the highest difficulty setting. (Also, the best items cannot be gambled)

While the game does borrow from others in its genre, it manages to bring those elements into a very playable and addictive package.

So, you might be asking yourself, SELF! I've already played the 'greats' of the genre, is this game still worth it? 

Yes, absolutely. The game is a steal at its price.

In conclusion, the title builds upon a very solid foundation of Quality-of-Life elements aRPG fans expect, while adding in some new surprises as well.

I'd highly recommend this to anyone, fans of the genre or not.

This is a great game with a lot of choices for your build. You pick 1 of the 4 classes and start ploughing through zombies, ghosts, rats and other dark creatures. The action is fast, and you can easily die when you do not pay attention. The items are quite diverse and unlock all kinds of cool special abilities. As you play you gather currency you can use to buy new gear with, or gamble for new gear. The game plays like an old school ARPG (like Diablo 2). 

I would give this game a 8,5 out of 10 in the current state, and it has the potential to grow into a 9 or higher with future updates (currently it's a cool early acces game).

38171705.review:
Do you love Diablo 2, Path of Exile, Grim Dawn, or Torchlight? If the answer is yes then you've struck pixelated gold.  Chronicon was certainly inspired by some of these titles, most definitely Diablo 2.  Considering it's in early access right now, it really does not get much more polished than this. I have encountered perhaps one or two minor bugs.  The developer frequently communicates with players on the forums, listens to feedback and is incredibly receptive to it good and bad, no matter how critical.  He responds to you, questions your feedback and whether it would be included in the game, and works on reported bugs almost immediately.  You don't see this kind of interaction and dedication often anymore.  This guy is passionate about making his game into something spectacular.  This alone is a reason to buy the game; it feels good to support dedicated and hard working developers.  

Back to the point though,  I've put in about 30 hours of play time and I've only made 1 character.  In fact, it took me about this much time to reach 100, the max level at the moment.  There are 3 other classes to experiment with, so the replayability is there in that regard.

However, Chronicon suffers from a few issues that did not take long to realize.  The only big one seriously worth mentioning that may or may not ruin the experience for some  is the loot.  The worst part about the loot is that it becomes VERY redundant VERY quickly.  What does this mean? Well, you can come across the exact same unique type item 5 or more times in a two hour session.   You will hear a loud THUD in game notifying you that a unique or legendary item has dropped, then when you pick it up and find out it's basically the same thing from before... it's kind of disappointing and makes looking or grinding for loot meaningless and just not something you look forward to at all.  

When you do happen to find a moderately good item it will be MARGINALLY better than your currently equipped one, even if your old item is 20-30 levels lower than your new item, the new item will hardly be an upgrade.  To make the new item worth equipping you will need to enchant it, modify the kind of sockets it has, reroll the attributes, and essentially fine tune the item at a vendor to your exact liking... this is a great feature but it's time consuming and feels like a cheap attempt at simply avoiding designing BETTER gear.  Also, there is no way to take gems out of equipment.  You can only destroy the gems and keep the item.  Why? This seems so backwards to me.  The polished variety of gems (the third tier and best gems you can acquire) must be crafted using lower tier gems and can be really costly/time consuming, because you have to farm for lower tier gems  before you can upgrade them.   

I don't mean to sound overly critical here at all but this glaring issue with loot is noticeable fairly early on and gets progressively worse the closer you are to max level.  You would think different and considerably better loot is obtainable the higher level you are but in the grand scheme of things, it feels like the opposite. 

One more small issue I have is the minimap.  You can shift between different sizes and where the minimap is placed in game.  The problem is when you want it to take up most of your screen, it is difficult to see particularly in certain environments while you're playing.  It could use a little enhancement I suppose because I've had to really focus on the minimap at points just to figure out where I'm going.  I realize it's not meant to be very bold or anything because it would get in the way of the game, however, there should be a balance between not being a distraction and visibility.

Despite some of its flaws, which I'm sure will be worked on prior to official launch day, Chronicon is a lot of fun and can scratch that itch you've been feeling for a solid hack n slash experience. It's definitely a good time, easy to learn, has 5 difficulties and isn't complex or intricate like Path of Exile which to some may be a plus or a negative depending on what you're after.  Ultimately It's worth the asking price in my opinion.

38162401.review:
a somewhat fun little arpg if you like to feel overpowered as you plough through fairly shallow content. it is proably only really worth it if you catch it on sale and need to scratch that arpg itch but have already beaten everything else.

pros:
- responsive input, no lag, well-optimized. feels very "snappy"
- fast paced once you've got some +movement speed and a mobility skill
- tons of useful user interface options
- cute sprite pixel art
- funny boss voice lines and characterful npc dialogues
- wide variety of skills, effects and elemental damage types
- multiple difficulty options
- very few, very minor bugs

huge detailed list of cons/flaws: 

- there is almost zero story / plot / lore / worldbuilding / character development
- suffers from extreme screen clutter. you can often barely see what's happening amidst all of the spell effects
- the mechanic of slowing your character's movement speed by half when walking over obstacles (pots, foliage etc, which ther are thousands of, everywhere, always) is completely unnecessary and irritating
- the map is very hard to read, especially in dark or grey areas, which there are a lot of. it can't be scrolled, it has no background opacity option, the player icon is brown on brown/grey, and it can't be zoomed out or scaled down below 100%. you also have to press tab four times to toggle it
- lots of enemy types that manage to be irritating without being difficult, especially for shorter range builds (enemies that burrow, become invisible, leap around rapidly)
- lending to that, there are not enough "pull" skills to draw mobs in (barbarian only i think)
- mysterious crystal chest puzzles are repetitive
- killstreaks are fun to try for but are often interrupted in dumb ways, eg by packs of mobs that slowly emerge from the ground and can't be attacked until after a lengthy animation
- powerful unique and legendary gear is honestly just far too common, with 0% magic find
- even a fully expanded inventory is still too limited in size for the amount of loot that drops
- game seems too easy on the second-highest difficulty setting, but too difficult on the highest
- incoming damage feels very spiky; it's either so negligible as to be pointless, or you die instantly without being able to react. no in between. tanky builds are not viable
- shrines are common and very strong in a game where you are already overpowered. but one in ten shrines instant-kills you for no reason?
- the semi-common "elixir of flames" consumable gives a 3800% damage burn, which allows you to kill all bosses in like 4 seconds. what's the point? 
- if there are any cool secret areas, they are a little too well-hidden, because i never found any
- no character appearance options and gear isn't represented visually
- bosses all have boring vanilla mechanics until the 4th act. they just stand or slowly move around and cast aoe spells
- every effective build type with every character feels very same-ish. you spam one single powerful aoe ability that you pump up with tons of passives.
- gemming and enchanting offer too little of a return on investment to be worthwhile pre-endgame, especially with how frequently you are replacing your gear
- lots of pointless/useless resources, stats and bonuses like mana, rage, souls, thorns, light radius, orbitals, minions, health and mana globe pickups. things that are there but aren't worth investing in or just kind of get managed automatically without changing how you play or equip yourself in any meaningful way
- lots of the sound effects are pretty grating
- tilesets become repetitive. there are tons of caves that all look the same. every "mysterious portal" map uses the same tileset.
- some story maps are unnecessarily huge
- high-tier class armor sets provide no interesting bonuses or skill modifications. just % increase to damage type, % increase to passive proc chance 
- the tooltip descriptions for certain stats and effects is obscure and unclear

4/10

37560147.review:
A little ARPG with a lot of fun!

Positive:
- Nice art style (not for everyone, but I like it)
- Four classes with different playstyles
- Five difficulties, can be changed before loading the character
- Four skill trees for every character
- Multiple skills to choose from for different skill slots (for example three different heal skills with different healing mechanics to choose from for the Templar)
- Additional Mastery tree, with capped bonuses and a few which allow to spent unlimited points into it (like flat damage for example)
- Easy to access respec potions, they allow to try out all the possibilites the skill trees offer
- A lot of gems and an enchanting system allow for customization of items
- Main story with currently four acts (a fifth is in development) with different themes
- Endgame anomalies: Randomized areas with growing difficulty for every higher level
- A lot of options to adjust UI parts
- Very good performance even in high dense areas with a lot of stuff going on
- Low price of $9.99 for a lot of possible hours of playtime

Negative:
- Not as much depth as similar games like Grim Dawn (especially item affixes)
- The controls are a bit different then other ARPGs. I prefer the WASD movement here, although I always play ARPGs with click to move (which is possible to choose in Chronicon, but the targeting feels weird).
- The music/soundtrack can be a bit of repetitive after some time
- Shrines have a low chance to kill you, which can be annoying

36701970.review:
[WTF is Chronicon ?!]

A total steal for the money spend. It's a diablo style dungeon crawler with pretty much everything you would expect. Loot, Gems, Entchanting, Skill trees etc.  It's pretty impressive what the dev have done here, this game feels like diablo 2 and in some aspects even better.

Chronicon has 4 classes, all of them have a different source of energy for their abilities.
The appearance of the class depends on the number of skill points used in a specific skill tree.
Every class has class specific Items and Item sets. 

Berserker (your typical high dps melee brawler guy)
Warden (a Hunter/ Ranger with some magic skills as well)
Templer (your typical Tank/Dps/Heal hybrid)
Warlock (Mage - the caster dude, any game needs one tho)

Items in Chronicon have 6 different tiers: Ordinary, Common, Enchanted, Rare, Unique and Legendary. There is also a tier called True Legendary, which are items that can only drop when you have a character level of 100 and are playing on Legendary difficulty. 


You will be extremely surprised how good this game is (if you like the artstyle of course !) 
It is filled with content and I would pay 20 $ for this EA. (hell mabey even more..)


Subworld is a one-man independent game studio based in Gothenburg, Sweden.
It has been run since its founding day in summer 2015 by Daniel "Squarebit" Stigsjöö. 

With over 50 updates the dev is a working maniac and always lurking in the Forum, building the game WITH the players.
He is a prime example how early access is done right. Kudos to him.


Do you recommend this game? 
If you like the artstyle and the genre, this one is a must buy. Seriously try it out at least.


~Chronicon is estimated for final release in 2018.~


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zHmtgWtxEUQ

(love this guy, leave him a like)

36534961.review:
The best ARPG since Diablo 2. Just everything you'd expect from a modern ARPG: an extensive skill system that you can easily respec to try entirely new builds, massive randomized maps with a satisfying variety of terrain, huge swathes of enemies with varying abilities, resocketable gem system, gambling, enchanting, etc. But you can tell the dev is also a gamer as he put in a lot of quality of life features like filtering loot, autopickup, scaling and tweaking all UI elements, hotkeys are fully customizable on the slottable skill bar. Seriously this game just takes all the refinements of two decades in the genre and polishes them perfectly. Beyond amazing for a one man team.

Each of the 4 classes has 4 skill trees that play completely differently, and you can mix and match between them. Plus a passive Mastery system to support your choices. Makes for a lot of fun finding good synergies and unique approaches that fit your gameplay style. Tons of stat information available, fun legendary items and affix/prefixes, very easy to process and understand what you're doing (especially with an informative wiki style guide in-game that covers every keyword).

Really just the whole complete package!

If you were lucky enough to find this criminally underrated game, just buy it, you'll be so happy you did.

36284935.review:
If you're a fan of loot-oriented, Diablo-style ARPGs, don't be fooled by Chronicon's appearance. This game can be taken as seriously as its better-looking brethren (Grim Dawn, Path of Exile, Diablo III, and Torchlight II). It doesn't reinvent the wheel, but it performs well and thoughtfully with almost every aspect you'd expect from the genre. Most importantly, it nails the loot system, keeping you addicted from the get-go. This one man's project might even turn out to be tastier than what the creator of Diablo, David Brevik, is [url=https://twitter.com/davidbrevik/status/917404836156420097]cooking[/url] at the moment. Of course, that's not a fair comparison, because that tweet is everything we know about Brevik's game, but still!

Don't be fooled by my low hours, either. I tend to avoid playing unfinished games too much, so I can enjoy them even more when they're finally finished. But rest assured, there is already more than enough content to keep you busy for the price, especially if you're into perfecting your gear and the endless progression that comes with these games.

35612339.review:
This is a great ARPG in the vein of Diablo 2, Path of Exile, and Grim Dawn. It's a ton of fun and it does a lot of things right:

- fast-paced
- huge skill variety, and they feel powerful and different
- good itemization, with uniques that feel exciting to find

and here are a few complaints (in case devs read this lol):

- deadends in random dungeons are too long. sometimes you have to backtrack a long way, which sucks
- minimap is hard to read in screen-covering mode
- menu UI is too small. you can't move when the menu is open anyway, so why not use the whole screen? then the symbols in the crafting menus could be less cryptic!
- keeping track of your health is pretty tough since it's a teeny bar. Many games in this genre use globes for this, which are easier to see in your peripheral vision

Some minor nitpicks, but this game is super fun!

35508931.review:
액트 3까지 약 12시간 들여 깼음.  리뷰는 여러 사람이 썼으니 공략만 쓰겠음.

직업은 4개지만 직업 하나에도 스킬트리가 4~6개 씩 있음.
예를 들어 템플러의 경우 물리, 불, 전기, 신성 트리가 있음.

최대 장착 가능한 스킬 수가 마우스 좌우클릭, 1~4 까지 총 6개 밖에 안되므로
스킬트리 전체를 타서 마법을 난사하는 식으로 플레이하는건 불가능하지만

물리 트리의 타운트(적을 한 곳으로 모아줌)를 가져오거나 신성트리의 궁극기 (25초 동안 쿨타임을 매우 짫게 해줌)
를 섞는 등 다양하게 해볼 수 있음. 이런 점에서는 디아보다 더 발전한 시스템이라고 생각함.

시작 난이도는 노말 내지는 이지가 좋음.
캐릭터 선택 화면에서 난이도를 바꿀 수 있기 때문에 부담 없이 이지로 시작하는게 마음이 편함.
히로익 같은 걸로 시작하면 첫 맵 입구에서 유니크몹이 서성거리며 마법을 갈기는 식으로
진행도 못할 수 있음.

어차피 난이도 높게 해놓고 깨도 아노말리는 1부터 시작하므로 (아노말리에는 난이도 적용이 안되는 듯 함) 이지로 액트 3까지 편하게 도는게 정신건강에는 더 좋을 수 있음.

장비창을 보면 gear 퍼센티지가 보이는데 이것이 200을 넘기면 하드. 250을 넘기면 히로익 추천함.

35413278.review:
Review as of Build 0.65.3

TL;DR = Addictive hack n slash, crazy amount of customization, loot, and options.  Will only get better.

Fans of Hack and Slash rejoice!  Really fun gameplay from each of the character classes.  Smooth level progression with a completely bonkers amount of customization, abilities, talent trees, mastery trees, and an absolutely insane amount of useful treasure!  Treasure and item drops scale with player level, keeping legendary drops fresh at any level.

The menus and ui layout are a bit cumbersome at first, but with more customization options than any other game of this type, I was able to quickly setup a layout that was comfortable and familiar.

I like the art design for certain things, but wish there was more animations, and also wish gear showed up when equipped.  As is, levels and monsters feel very static and lifeless, but it's still fun to try to run through slaughtering everything and gaining bigger killstreaks.

The sound is probably one of the weakest elements of the game, mostly feeling like placeholder, but hey, it works for now.  I mean, it's still early access and only build 0.65.3 and feels more polished than many other launch games.

35303390.review:
Chronicon is a ARPG with lots of loot and tons of different ways to play.
Almost all maps are randomly generated.

You can compare the skill tree to Grim Dawn, but with choice from all trees instead of just 2.
There are allot of effects your attacks make, but because of the pixel style it can be cluttered at times.

Overall it's a really fun game, I like loot games like this.

Keep in mind that it's not a complete game. Here are issues I have with it when writing this review:

- The start of the game gets easy fast, however suddenly the game ramps up and you'll die quite allot.
  But if you keep going you'll get good loot and it becomes easy again. I am playing on the second highest difficulty and the only thing stopping me from playing max difficulty is that bosses take FOREVER to kill. The game needs a bit more balancing.
- The font can be wonky sometimes because of the filtering. The bigger text has a strange font that seems a bit out of place, to me it doesn't really matter.
- You can filter out equipment depending on rarity, but potions, scrolls and chest keys will always be highlighted. I wish health potions, mana potions, keys and scrolls of return where automatically picked up. That would make looting a bit less tedious. 
- There are no dedicated slots for items you always carry like health and mana potions.
- Story text scrolls down far too slowly, making me skip all dialogs because my patience runs out.
- The minimap shows too little and I end up having the big map overlay on at all times. It kinda gets in the way. A zoom slider and size for the map would really help.
- The thick pixelated effects can really clutter up your screen, I wouldn't mind if they where the only thing not pixelated.
- All other stat-changing potions have to be used manually. I'd rather have them used automatically.

There are things it does really well too:

- Variety in color schemes of enemies depending on their elements.
- Thick hordes of many, many enemies.
- Lots of elements.
- Three types of gems of ALL elements you can fit in 3 different types of socket. All gems also have 3 levels. Finally, you can put sockets on items whenever you want, irregardless of level.
- You can make complex synergies with your attacks and set bonusses on your equipment.
- You can upgrade, reroll and reroll the numbers of all secondary stats without being locked to 1 afterwards.
- Endgame levels that get progressively more difficult. When you get stuck, you can lower the level of those levels with a scroll.
- I love the music, the forest has my favorite soundtrack of the game.
- Cool sound effects.
- You get a satisfying explosion when you get a killstreak, it would be cool if there were more tiers though.
- NO MOVEMENT SPEED CAP! YEAH FAST! CHILIDAWGS!

34750262.review:
Let me start off by saying I stumbled across this game in the Steam store in my never-ending search for good loot-grinding games/ARPGs.  And this one is really fun and satisfying.

You pick between four classes: Berserker (melee fist-fighter), Warden (an archer, basically), Templar, and Warlock (combination of a mage and necromancer).  Each class has multiple talent trees you can invest points in that result in different active and passive skills and damage types.  I'd recommend trying them all; I typically dont like melee classes but I'm loving my Templar.

You start off in a building called the Chronicon, with a merchant and several other NPCs that offer services you can unlock as you progress.  You grab the first couple quests, and off to the dungeons you go.

Dungeons are filled with enemies (duh), loot from said enemies and chests (double-duh), traps, and mini-dungeon rooms.  Enemies can have different buffs applied to them or be a rarer quality which makes them give better loot or have different fighting mechanics; for example, one buff might make the monster explode after you kill it.

Loot is broken down into tiers: Ordinary (white), Enchanted (blue), Rare (Purple), Unique (Pink), and Legendary (Red).  As with any other game, higher tier loot offers better stats and sometimes interesting passives, such as a pet, or a floating orb that does damage to targets near you.  Loot also consists of Crystals (currency), multiple tiers of multiple colors of gems, and some other weird crystal currencies I haven't found a use for yet.

The game offers 5 (I think?) difficulties, and I've been played on the third/fourth highest right from the start and the game feels balanced enough.  Rare monsters and boss fights will have you chugging hp/mana pots like no other, so make sure you buy lots from the merchant NPC.  Boss fights actually start to have mechanics once you get past the first one, so be aware of their abilities, how the combo them, when they're going to use them, etc.

Local multiplayer is REALLY fun if you have a friend to speed-run through the dungeons with and build up monster-gibbing exp combos.

Overall this game is really fun, the pixel art is nice, and there are LOADS of puns and humor to appreciate (for example, a miniboss that's a Bat named Outahel.  Get it?  Or a treasure-hoarding goblin that drops a Unique ring, named Mollug (LOTR fans, anyone?).  The game is really charming, the music is relaxing and catchy, and the combat gets really fun.

That being said, here are my suggestions/cons:

-Early game combat is REALLY dull.  The first 10 levels or so on a Berserker and Templar are especially boring.  You do very little damage, the only attack skill you have sucks, and drains mana like no other.  They really need to do something about the early-game.  The game should be fun right from the beginning, not 10 levels in; and some of the people in the reviews have mentioned this as well.  However as soon as you get your 2nd/3rd skills, fights get really fun.

-The loot filter could use some work, and its buggy when you play local multiplayer.  When I use a keyboard and my gf uses a controller, after you defeat the first boss in the secondary zones I cant click the names of the loot to pick them up like 60-70% of the time like I usually can.

-More classes would be nice.  Even if you had to split the Warlock into a Wizard and Necromancer and give them each different skill trees, or add some kind of spear-wielding mid-range class, or maybe some kind of assassin.

-I'm not sure if it happens later on, but more loot that gives pets or active skills would be cool.


I really love what you guys have done with this game so far.  Excellent work!

OVERALL RATING: 9/10

34480444.review:
A strong entry into the ARPG LootGrinder genre. I've put hundreds of hours into Diablo III, I've played TorchLight 2 through two times and I've dabbled around in Path of Exile.

This game is honestly my favorite of them all. I held off on it for the longest time due to how "janky" it looked in the trailers and it's true, even diving in and playing, the visuals are nothing amazing. 

But the gameplay soon swept me up. It was slow in the beginning but I told myself, all ARPGs are slow in the start, because they are. Once my character got solidly rolling along, I was having alot of fun with it and I still am. I'm gonna be putting many, many, many hours into this game for absolute sure. I'll go ahead and wager 100+ at the minimum. 

The high point of this game to me is the loot. Loot rains from the sky in this game, you find tons of items everywhere, and while leveling I was always finding not just *better* items but items that felt exciting and like major upgrades. This guy gets it. The CORE of this genre is finding exciting loot and atleast in my opinion, this game answers that call beautifully.

I kept finding items that I'd stop and go:  "Oh wow, look at this one."

That is what makes this game shine. 

The controls are good. Again, the visuals are not that great, this includes many of the abilities but there is no doubt the abilities respond and fulfill their functions as expected. Over all, this game is in a very solid state, atleast in my experience.

The dev is also all over the forums, he's been engaging with this community, honest, forthcoming and responsive to his playerbase's concerns, questions and problems. He is clearly invested in working hard on this game. He is one of those devs that is demonstrating how you handle this gig. He is doing a brilliant job.

The only thing that may be a turn off for some people is the dev has done alot of thinking about it and confirmed there will be *NO* Multiplayer. He did not plan for it in the start and that it is beyond his skills at the moment and beyond his time table to go back and try to accomplish it now. He has said if there is a Chronicon 2 to follow, it will come with online multiplayer right from the start but that  this one will not have it. 

Beyond that, this is an absolutely great game once you look past it's graphics. You can't judge a book by it's cover, as they say, and this game is yet another reason you should never judge a game on it's initial looks. This is a real gem.

33723061.review:
ARPG done right.  Early Access done right.
[list]
[*]Fun game that plays well, i.e. not entering EA too early.
[*]Bugs get squashed in a timely fashion.
[*]Developer is active and interacts frequently on the forums, in a very kind and professional manner.
[*]Four distinct classes with varied gameplay; just switch between them if you ever get bored with one.
[*]Progression occurs at a comfortable pace; never experienced any lull.
[*]Animations and sound effects are very nice for an indie title; combat is pretty visceral.
[*]Skill and build balance is in progress, with a big push coming soon.
[*]Last point I want to make, but definitely not the least: the community is very nice, with a Discord chat room where even the dev shows up once in a while.
[/list]
This game (and its sole dev) deserves all the praise it is getting.  Is it the Second Coming?  No.  Is it for everyone?  Definitely not.  But is it fun and recommendable to anyone that finds the genre and/or media interesting?  Hell yeah!  (Edit: unless you absolutely need online multiplayer support, then no, sorry, sucks for you but such is life.)

33710014.review:
Actually the best aRPG of 2016 - criminal that major media didn't pick this one up.

If you can get past the Pixel Graphics, you'll find the mechanics are rock solid, the flow to combat joyfull (500+ kill streaks... MOOOOONSTER KILL) and a surprising depth to the skill trees / items / crafting. Oh, sure, you'll have seen it before, but the Dev understands his medium and it's all done very professionally.

For a title in EA, more than worth it. 

Content wise, there's a nice mix of pre-made maps (story) and RNG 'chunks' made on the fly (again, showing that the dev understands how aRPGs should work), four classes and a whole lot of spicey goodness.

$9 for this?


Get it. It's almost as good as Grim Dawn (if totally not GrimDark, think more "Cutesy Monty Python") and a lot faster paced. 

Come back to me when you kill 500+ monsters in a rush and don't have a smile...

33412137.review:
Dieses Spiel hat die weithin bekannte "... und noch ne Runde"-Sogwirkung, die zuletzt nur Grim Dawn bei mir persönlich geweckt hat. Der Entwickler hat genau verstanden, worauf es bei einem Hack & Slay ankommt: Es muss krachen, die Gegner müssen reihenweise fallen und dem Spieler fliegt Loot um die Ohren, bis es keinen Spaß mehr macht. 

Chronicon schafft es, dass ich mich recht schnell ziemlich mächtig fühle und wenn ich dann aus den Latschen gehauen werde, weil ich nicht aufgepasst habe, dann ist das nicht die Schuld des Spiels, sondern meine eigene. Nun gut, an dieser Stelle würde ich mir wünschen, dass es ein deutlicheres Feedback geben würde, wenn meine Gesundheit niedrig ist, denn der leicht flackernde Balken in der Ecke kann ganz schnell mal in Vergessenheit geraten, wenn der gesamte Bildschirm wackelt, Zahlen wie ein Heuschreckenschwarm durch die Gegend sausen und die Soundkulisse ein riesiges Trara veranstaltet, weil irgendwo auf der Map ein Epic gedroppt ist. (Ein Detail, das ich sehr schön finde.) Was nicht ist, kann ja noch werden, schließlich ist das Spiel im Early Access.

Wer Handlung sucht, sollte besser an anderer Stelle weiter suchen, denn Chronicon wird für das bisschen Geschichte keine Preise gewinnen. Es ist im Akt-System ala Diablo aufgebaut und klaut sich Teile der Handlung aus anderen Spielen zusammen, aber who the hell cares? Als ob es bei H&S-Spielen um die Story gehen würde. Wenn ich ne gute Geschichte suche, spiele ich Baldurs Gate - hier braucht es nur einen Vorwand, um einige Zombies mit extremen Facelifting zu bearbeiten.

Dafür gefällt mir der Sound ziemlich gut. Musik höre ich bei all dem Gekrache und Geplatze nicht großartig, die ist zwar irgendwo, aber hält sich eher bedeckt. Ansonsten sind die Soundeffekte großartig gewählt und tragen bei der Entfaltung der Suchtwirkung ordentlich bei. Kristalle klimpern, Leder-/Ketten-/Platten-/Stoffrüstungen erzeugen beim Aufheben zufriedenstellende Geräusche, Heiltränke blubbern, wie man es gewohnt ist ... da kann man sich recht schnell drin verlieren.

Zur Charakterentwicklung habe ich noch nichts gesagt, aber die ist auch nicht besonders komplex: Man steigt zweierlei Stufen auf: Charakter und Mastery. Mit jeder Stufe bekommt man einen Punkt für die jeweils zuständigen Skilltrees und fertig ist der Laden. Die Skilltrees erinnern mich ein wenig an World of Warcraft anno dazumal, es sind viele Prozentsachen, die den Schaden passiv erhöhen - Skills bekommt man gelegentlich, 5 oder 6 an der Zahl, bei denen man aus zwei oder drei Alternativen auswählen kann. Komplexer wird die ganze Angelegenheit bei der Ausrüstung, denn da kann man Steine reinzimmern, Verzauberungen aufwerten oder sie ändern, maximieren, optimieren, bis man das Item zur vollsten Zufriedenheit entwickelt hat, um es zwei Stufen später gegen ein anderes auszutauschen. 

Insgesamt muss ich sagen, dass mir Chronicon sehr, sehr gut gefällt. Im ganzen Sud von Schrott, der hier auf Steam herumwabert, schwimmt diese kleine Perle an der Spitze und ich hoffe, dass noch viel mehr Leute dieses Spiel für sich entdecken, um dem Entwickler unter die Arme zu greifen.

33277713.review: First and foremost, let me say that I am an RPG nut since I was 5 years old playing Pokemon Red for the first time.  This game is everything and MORE that I wanted in it.  The music is beautiful and atmospheric, the loot has several tiers such as ordinary (white), Rare (Purple), Unique (Light Purple), Legendary (Red), and True Legendary (<Orange>).  The game is set up so that there are 4 classes - The Warden, Templar, Warlock, and Berserker.  Each of these classes has 4 different talent trees.  The max level is level 100, so that means 100 Talent points to spend any way you wish.  You can also respec at any time by buying a potion at the shop.  You also have Mastery Talents that level up as you level up.  Here is where it gets fun.  Mastery talents can go infinitely high.  This means that if you love to farm and grind that your character can power up infinitely.  Kind of like Diablo 3 they have included "Anomolies"  which are essentially Greater Rifts that level up each time you beat it.  This is not time based so you can go at your leisure.  This is a must have for any RPG fan out there, seriously!  10/10 am playing through it again. Hope this helps my friends!

33224933.review:
Steam里的第一篇评测就献给这款游戏吧！
It's the first game in steam which makes me want to leave my comment. 

首先要声明的是，这款游戏胜在游戏性。如果你是比较轻度的用户，或者是画面党，入坑需谨慎。但是如果你本来就喜欢暗黑3、流放之路，喜欢钻研各种技能的自由搭配，那么这款游戏绝对不容错过。
It's the varieity of gameplay method which makes the game great, not the game screen or art style. Be careful if you are not a "heavy" user. But if you seek for combination of skills and tresures with random attributes, if you play and love games like Diablo III or POE, this one will just be your cup of tea. 

优点 Advantages：
-巨丰富的技能搭配。目前有4个职业，每个职业有4种天赋，满级后的技能点足够你同时发展2-3种天赋。不同系天赋之间也设置了不少巧妙的关联。
-Soooo many combinations of skills. 4 classes, 4 kind of talents for each class! Reach lv100 and you will get enough skill points to combine more than 2 kinds of talent! There are also smart links between different talent trees.

-巨强的装备系统。粉装，橙装，远古橙，套装，你想要的应有尽有。每一个套装都能诞生一种build。单机游戏无进度压力的情况下，完全可以多多探索娱乐性强虽然效率不高的build。
-Soooo powerful equipment system. Set items bring us new builds. In an offline game you do not have to compete with other users and you will have plenty of time to discover fun builds!

-巨无敌的附魔系统。橙装、套装只是部分属性固定，大多数属性仍然可以洗。全打满减CD或是堆无限高的击中回血？想想都刺激
-Sooooo great enhance system. All of the equipments (including Legendary ones!) have random attributes which can be rerolled! Imagine a whole set of equipment with CooldownReduce attribute or HealthOnHit!

-无限的角色成长，满级后仍有一套专精点数系统让你刷无止境；聚聚们大秘境已经破千层！
-Infinite growth! Even if you reach lv100 you still have master points to earn!

极待改善Things to be improved：
-本游戏没有中文（虽然我并不需要=v=不过有中文利于推广，毕竟游戏内容比较重度）并且只支持热座联机（虽然对我而言已经够了因为我和女票一起在家玩）
-前期很容易坑走新手。对于刚入或者要入的小伙伴，一定要耐着性子打到大约20级，世界会变得不一样！
-No Chinese languge for now. Supporting Chinese will absolutely popularize this great game. And only hot-seat mode. Online mode will also bring more users.

-装备更换不改变角色外观。物品ICON做的那么cool不改变Avatar是这游戏最大的遗憾！偷懒一点也可以角色达到某装备等级后整体换个皮肤呀！
-EQUIPMENTS DOES NOT LEAD TO AVATAR CHANGES! It's a waste that you have even made a lot of cool item icons. A easier idea for this is to change the avatar once the user's equipment value reach a certain line.


-箱子找东西太变态了因为一箱子都是橙装没有搜索。。。
-We need Search function to find a certain item from hundreds of legendary equipments in inventory!

然而瑕不掩瑜，300m的大小完全够玩300小时游戏时间。我要再去肝我的第三个角色了吼吼
Anyway it's still a great game. The size of 300M can bring us more than 300h game time. I'm going to build the third charater now!

Hope that Multiplayer will become online.

Very nice hack & slay game so far!

32756344.review:
Bought Chronicon during sale. I have high hopes for Chronicon however it's still very early in development. Given the current state of the game there is a lot of potential here, gameplay is solid however not enough content to keep me replaying the same areas again and again. 

I will be refunding and putting this back on my wishlist for further updates. It's still not quite up to par with other games I could be playing for the same price range. I'll be waiting till the next Summer sale. I've played enough to know that I'm not as entertained as I could be with this game. I would like to say it gives me nostalgia for mmorpgs such as ragnarok online and tibia, or a combination of the two, there is a tactical element to this game which I find appealing. Trying the game out first on veteran mode made me proceed carefully and not rush into trouble and I found trying out skills to be essential to the experience however the skill menu doesn't clearly indicate how the skills feel until you try them. Enemy ai and pathfinding could use a little work and making enemies more unique from each other. 

This game is quickly falling behind newer games, some changes need to be made to keep it current. But I'll leave that to the designer. I'll update this review after seeing progress into the development and putting some hours into it.

Pros:

- Dialogue is actually well written which surprised me quite a bit. (made me want to read more story)
- Skill options are varied, picking a class doesn't tunnel you into a specific build.
- Skills scale based on points invested, always nice.

Cons:

- UI is very unpolished, too small and not very intuitive.
- Walls of text instead of text boxes instead of clickable text boxes.
- Skills aren't very well explained, there should be an example of the skill animation.
- No visual portraits or lack of, leaving too much to the imagination.
- All character and enemy sprites could be improved.
- Lack of online co-op to play with friends.

32617211.review:
A TL;DR for this game:

If you liked D2 but wished it was slightly faster paced, or you were disappointed with D3 because of the way loot works in that game, give this a shot. The only thing you might dislike is the pixel graphics, but I recommend you give it a try anyway. This is the most fun I've had in an ARPG in a long long time.

The skill trees are dense, so even if there are 4 classes, they can all spec in 4 different ways, and skill resets are basically free (not sure if this will change later). Lots of customization options here.

The gameplay isn't super grindy, and loot is satisfyingly great. Lots of zones as well so you can farm a whole bunch of areas in one go. 

You can also re-roll stats and upgrade/maximize stats on your drops, so you're not grinding hours and hours for the same drop to get perfect rolls. Enchanter is really a godsend. 

And of course, there are items that will tailor to your gameplay and spec (mostly based around what element and skill type you want to focus on), which gives you a reason to grind mobs end-game.

Overall, this is a really fantastic game. Even though it's EA, it definitely feels polished and ready to launch.

32572387.review: For someone who habitually gets bored fast, Chronicon just doesnt ever get boring to me. It has everything in an ARPG that I love. Multiple and unique classes, farmable gear, unique skills; just everything. The game is very well thought out, with numerous options that can be changed to suite the player. Its also not difficult to understand at all. Its very straight forward yet has great depth. Currently doesnt have online MP yet but definitely not a deal breaker for me. Should be a definite buy for anyone who wants a satisfyingly casual ARPG experience

Liking the character building in this. It feels like "Grim dawn" or "Titan Quest"'s  skill progression system. Yet with some extreme differences. Such as selecting which skill the pasives in its line buff. Such as the first skill slot gave me three choices for skills to put in that slot. Then that is buffed by a passive that is connected to it. Putting points into any skill in that pane increases that panes ?proficiency? skill. That gives passive buffs to the character, and also unlocka later skills in the pane.

The entire system is rather complex. The gameplay itself is rather basic. A 8 way isometric action rpg. Every enemy feels like a damage sponge. Anything above normal makes this much worse. As the enemies hp increases exponentially with the difficulty increase. The damage they do does as well, That is actually fun. If it didn't fell like it took  a hour to defeat any given enemy (exagerating, it liely on took a minute on the regular enemies and five on the champions on the highest difficulty. 31864687.review:
I have been meaning to write a positive review for this game for a long time. I have a few things to say before I list pros and cons. If you are a fan of ARPG titles this game has a great combat system and will keep you entertained for hours. Ok, let's get into my bread and butter.
PROS:
-Old school type skill tree with the ability to reroll from the get go to try out all kinds of diversity and make the perfect build for you!
-Infinite progression mastery tree to help supplement the stats you need to make your build shine and give you that extra power.
-The combat is fun.
-Dev that listens to the community and I feel deserves our support.
-Very playable on the highest difficulty.
-Decent story.
-Infinite progression system in anamolies that allows you to put your build/gear skills to the test if you are a major grinder.
CONS:
-No online multi. (you can couch co op though. It's better than nothing)
-No cosmetic effects from gear (a con for some. Others don't really care)
-Can feel like it doesn't stand out too much from other ARPGs at times.

All things considered I think this game is well worth it's price tag and have enjoyed it thus far. I look forward to following the dev for years to come.

30573516.review:
Chronicon is a pleasant surprise. For a long time, I have been searching for an ARPG to play, but none of those I tried succeeded at entertaining me. Until I found Chronicon. This game is DEFINITELY worth your attention.

TLDR: ARPG done the right way, 9/10 (highly recommended)

I finished all three available acts in approximately 18 hours. During this time I haven't been bored or annoyed for a single moment. The leveling is reasonably fast, but it will definitely get slowed down a bit when the game is finished. Within 20 hours, I got to level 85 (the cap is 100), while playing on Veteran difficulty. That made me really happy, because I detest having to farm the entire evening and getting like 3 levels out of it.

The fighting system can be described as a pure carnage. After I got over the slow start, got my set of skills and better gear, the bloodbath started. I played frost-fire warlock that specialized in corpse shattering and burning. Most of the time I would just run around, turning enemies into chain-exploding nuclear bombs. The challenge of getting rewarding high kill-streaks makes you play as stylishly and brutal as possible, ensuring a lot of fun in the process.

The skill system is remarkable. There are 4 skill trees for every class that you can combine as you please. Some skills are of course slightly imbalanced, but given the fact that the game is still in the early access, I expect them to be tweaked. You can also easily reset your skills and masteries with a cheap potion, so you can experiment with your builds. Neat!

The difficulty itself could use a bit of balancing as well. Most of the time I would just run around and blow everything up. Sometimes I even instantly blew up bosses. But there were a few bosses who would just instakill me a few times, even though I was doing my best at dodging and kiting. 

Items in this game are just great. There are tons of loot dropping constantly, so I would suggest smartly setting up your item filter for the Alt-key. This feature is handy and makes looting and sorting through stuff comfortable. Items of high rarity DO drop very often and moreover, all the legendary items (and maybe even unique, I don't remember) you find are available for your class. Amazing, isn't it?

On the other hand, I didn't find many uses for consumable items. As for the keys, I didn't have enough of them at the beginning, but now I have so much of them that it doesn't matter for me if the chests are locked anymore. Town portal scrolls are present basically just from the nostalgic obligation, as you easily gather more of them than you can use. I don't know what to think about these features, maybe they are a bit unnecessary. As for the buff potions, I didn't feel any need to use them, so I eventually stopped picking them up to save inventory space. I personaly think that consumable items could use a bit of developer's attention.

There is nothing much to tell about the story. I would say it's decent and it fits nicely with the game atmosphere. I don't care about the story in this type of game anyway, and usually skip story passages in additional playthroughs.

Music is nice and the "voice acting" made me giggle a few times. As for the art - I like the game visuals. It requires a bit of polishing here and there, but overall it's quite decent. I don't even mind the fact that the gear doesn't change the appearance of the character. What I would like to see though, is something that would make bosses look unique. Most of the bosses look like larger versions of regular mobs, which doesn't look that great. But then again, we are at the early access, so it may as well change in the future.

To sum up, the current state of the game offers a lot of entertainment. The developer is a nice person who updates fans with news regularly and swiftly comes to offer help to anyone in trouble. If he keeps up the good work, this game might become something very big. I wish him only the best and offer a big thumbs up, because he succeeded in something that even big companies regularly fail at - making a damn enjoyable game!

Final verdict: 9/10 (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)
Depending on the future state of full release, I may as well change the rating to 10/10 - yep, it's that good.

This game is basically a pixel arpg, pixel Diablo 3 or PoE. It is fun building your character and offers a few ways to build your own character, through the skill tree, not as crazy as PoEs but still gives plenty of ways to build your character. Through the mastery system, similiar to Diablos paragon system. And through gear, however, my major complaint about the game is the increibly difficult to obtain set pieces make building your characters gear much less entertaining than the other methods.

 I did not find the game difficult at any time, I leveled on a difficulty that I found myself not 1 shotting mobs, but not taking more than 3 on lesser mobs. I ended on the difficulty below the hardest at level 100. 

The game is in early access still so I'll give it the benefit that the end game anomaly system leaves much to be desired currently and there are only 3 of the acts so far. Hopefully once all 5 acts are out going from act 1-5 will give you a level 100 character. I cannot recall my exact level after finishing act 3, but it was over 60 and did not require too much farming for exp.

30250923.review:
When I first saw this game in the store I thought it looked like an uninspired ARPG school project.
After having played it for 30 hours I am happy to admit that my early and superficial judgement was 100% wrong.

The thing I am most baffled by is how in the world I managed to enjoy the shit out of an unfinished game with no story, uninspired graphics, no relatable characters and an uninteresting world. 

The key here is how well Chronicon puts together its mechanics. It feels good to play, and has enough going on mechanically to make it fun for hours on end. 

There is a real depth and complexity to every build, and you can tailor every item to your liking through an incredibly flexible enchanting system. The hunger for loot and xp, which drives any good ARPG, is present here, and it feels damn good to get new gear and skills to play around with all the way till lvl 100. 

Don't expect to dedicate your life to it, though. At around 30 hours I am spent and probably won't be playing much more of it. It's rare to find an ARPG I feel satisfied quitting, but this is one of them. I got more than my money's worth, and if more content gets added, maybe i'll check in again. (like, add online multiplayer and i'll buy it for all my friends)

I like this game a lot, and would recommend it to anyone slightly intrigued by it.

EDIT: Turns out I got another 50 hours out of it after writing the review. Still good.

30250894.review:
Try this game if you're any kind of fan of this genre. 
I'm surprised at how solid the mechanics and loot system are.
For $10 dollars it is a total bargain.

The levelling system is satisfyingly deep without being overwhelming...builds seem to be very easy to imagine and implement. You can also respec at basically any time with an inexpensive potion.  
I just finished Act 2 of 3 on Veteran difficulty and I haven't had to grind at all yet. That's a plus for me because it feels nicely balanced. I think in games like this, if you are putting a little thought into your levelling progression, you shouldn't need to grind until you get to the endgame stage.

Overall the game feels really nice to play with a few minor hangups...

I don't care for the art that much...I still play Diablo 2 and other pixel games so I'm not some big graphics snob; but I think the character models would be better served with smaller pixels and more detail. Right now things are kind of ugly. 

I also don't like that most of the bosses I've seen so far are just larger versions of normal mobs. This is especially unsettling because of the pixel problem I described above.

I would also like to see some improvements to the mini map. I play Path of Exile and Diablo 2 with the minimap on almost all the time without problems but it just doesn't work as well in this game. It would be better if the map was smaller or relegated to a corner of the screen with a larger more detailed map being accessible through the menu or a hotkey. 

All in all, this is a surprisingly good arpg, especially since it was made by ONE PERSON. That alone should get your money. Don't be afraid of this early access title, you'll be glad you picked it up. 

Now if you don't mind, I'm gonna go finish act 3 and then roll a new character!

30214777.review:
Please note that I am generally a harsh critic of games, so this positive review doesn't come lightly.

There are four classes: Templar, Berserker, Warden, Warlock.

Ok from those four you can make any class imaginable in every game, except perhaps a Floramancer from RIFT (a healer who heals others by damaging enemies).

Please note I have not yet played a Templar so I cannot comment. I will also add that playing the three classes of four there doesn't seem to be a healing class. If this game becomes super successful I can imagine a DLC or something to feel more immercive and team based. I believe the reason for the healer class being absent is that that's a hard job to do with leveling, as of course the game needs to function just as well in Single Player as well as Multiplayer.

Every class has 4-5 skill trees for maximum variety, mostly elemental variations of damage but the elements themselves are distinct from one another (cold tree is defensive and slows, fire tree burns stuff, etc.)

Warlock is my most experienced character. Your warlock is every mage, ever. He can dedicate himself to one strong element/tree, or spread out for more variety - for example a hellfire glass cannon, or a Necromancer gathering minions from all the trees.

The added variation is from the second experience bar - separately you gain levels in Masteries, which are pure passives and they augment your play even more. The masteries are quite varied and  I daresay they are yet another skill tree with many considerations.

The Skills are fantastic, I think a healing class or more co-operative skills would have made this game perfect, but it's a small loss and considering that would be hard to do with a controller skills are a solid 9/10

Finally there are the items - from common to unique you get your special things, even uniques roll random stats and you continue to find them at later levels - so your gear and drops are always around your level, but on the bright side it helps you better plan for the future. 

Some items are also sets, bonus possibilities are even greater there, but still nothing unexpected.

There's also enchantments but I haven't played that far into the game yet.

LEGENDARY/Super Legendary(Lvl100+) Items - OOOOK here's the good stuff, these items start offering even weirder suffixes which apply directly to skills. You thought that passive looked cool, but the AoE explosion was too small? Well here comes a massive buff from these boots! Now it's a skill you can base your entire build around. Stuff like that.

Overall the itemisation could have gone even more interestingly, but as of Early Access, I consider it a 8/10


Random facts: 

There's no hardcore mode.
The game keeps you mashing buttons and it's entertaining but if that's not fun enough you have to hold out until you get several skills to really feel like your character is being fleshed out.
Music is 6/10 - decent but nothing special.
Artwork 7/10
Graphics, well it's only the first area and this is E.Access but it looks a little dull. It's not annoying but it could be better 5/10
Game design - 8.5/10
The game is repetitive and some people don't like that but if you do enjoy Action RPGs then this will please you.
Local co-op, controller support, everything works great.
Hotkey economy - essentially you can only have around 6 active skills.
Controller support - I'm past my pro-gaming prime and I've comfortably settled for being a couch potato with an inferior instrument for gaming. This game is one of the best when it comes to controller support. For contrast I found Hero Siege very annoying.


On a final note I am seriously considering buying more copies of the game and sending it to random people, it's awesome and the devs deserve recognition for making great mechanics first, instead of a great looking broken P.o.s.

I hope this review has been helpful to you.

My wife and I have played through the existing campaign twice now, and will likely revisit it again once the next acts are added. It is enjoyable and accessible. The latest patches to overhaul the character progression have been particularly nice, as it felt like a much, much more broad set of builds became not only viable, but satisfying to play. The early game does suffer from some initial power creep, as abilities are introduced slowly to apply a learning curve, but this curve feels particularly slow. It will take several levels to get to the 'meat' of most any build, or even a reliable AoE ability.

Split screen coop was handled fairly well, with few glaring frustrations having been discovered through two playthroughs, the worst being a small bug that will likely be fixed. (When player one highlighted current items on the ground, player two was unable to attack while both were using gamepads. Minor, avoidable, and far from gamebreaking.)

I do not recall any crashes or other issues with the game, aside from the missing statue in act three, that is easily remedied by re-entering the area.

29662219.review:
[h1] Great hack and slash game with a retro look and modern/new/unique features, worth the price tag as is. [/h1]

I want to start by saying the BEST thing I have to say about this game for sure is the developer is extremely active in the community and very responsive, I was actually shocked to return to my suggestion post a day or two later and found the developer replied in roughly two hours!  Serious respect for the work this person is putting in!

I got this game thinking, "For $10 why not?  I could use a few hours of a new hack and slash action game."  But what I got was something so much more.  This game has a retro look and in some good ways a retro feel but it also has a lot of quality of life improvements that games like this have seen since the old Diablo 1 days and it also has some original and fun ideas too!

I've only played a few of the classes so far and this is what I can say from what little I've played:

[list][*]Templar is super easy mode for a while due to the massive life on hit you can get from the holy mastery, she just doesn't die.
[*]Warden is a bit slow to get going but once you get a few companions rolling and work out some gear it's pretty awesome and fun.
[*]Warlock I've barely played but it seemed to be pretty rough as you would expect from a "mage" class.
[*]Berserker I haven't touched.[/list]

The biggest down side I can say about this game so far is no online multiplayer.  So if you want to play multi player expect to have someone sitting next to you and using a game pad.

In greater detail here's some features in the game I like:
[list] [*]A good gambling system.
[*]A [i]phenominal[/i] enchanting system for amazing customizability of items you obtain. 
[*]There are random portals that will open up to a "dimentional pocket" where all the enemies have a random enchantment added on them for extra fun/challenge. 
[*]There are "Challenge scrolls" that drop and once used open a portal to a challenge arena with strong monsters and a boss to finish it, very cool!
[*]A great "endless dungeon" type feature after the story is cleared!
[*]Multiple choice skills!  For example you can pick a lightning arrow or lightning magic orb for a basic attack early on. (warden class) And that's just one of the four skill trees!  Sometimes you can pick between three different abilities for one spot in the skill tree.  Another example would be in the lightning skill tree for the warden you can pick between (esentially) a group of melee, group of caster or single healer pet for the companion in that tree.  Awesome stuff![/list]

There's just so many things right here and very few things I personally consider to be coming up short and it's still in development so there's a lot of time to see improvements and good changes made and even without them it's a fantastic game as is!  Worth the $10 price tag for sure!

29597850.review:
I picked this game up a couple of days ago after reading about it on the Grim Dawn forums.  I really wanted to hate it, I get a disturbing amount of joy out of disliking the indie craze that every dumb fan boy is jumping all over, but I can't.  This game really is killer for entertainment value.  I'll write a longer review when I get some time.

Suffice it to say, I'm a pretty fickle person when it comes to graphics.  When i first started looking at this game, I was disgusted with the graphical style, but it grew on me.  It actually has a bit of charm.

Balance seems to be a bit all over the place.  Both in terms of mobs and skills, but that's part of what makes the game fun.  I'm playing a lightning warden and this "Nimbus" Skill (a cloud that zooms around the map) is fantastic.  Cruises around, procs all my on attack effects, destroys the entire map.

What surprised me the most is the pace and responsiveness of combat.  It's excellent.  I'm playing with WASD and my mouse and I've been extremely pleased with the control of my character.  I'll probably crack out the gamepad tomorrow just to see how it compares, but it absolutely can be played with M+KB.

There isn't a ton in the way of a story, but in an action RPG about the loot hunt and explosively awesome build combinations, that doesn't bother me.  It's there if you want it to be, but isn't particularly intrusive.  I think the single developer has plans to rewrite some the dialogue to improve the overall lore.  

The map overlay is a bit inconsistent as well.  In some areas, it's too dark (makes seeing your character/what's beneath the overlay difficult) and in others it is far too light.  This is pretty minor, but you might occassionally find yourself annoyed by it.  Note, there is a setting to change the opacity, but given the fast/frenetic gameplay it seems a bit obtuse to have to.  

The class system/build system is excellent.  Kind of similar to Grim Dawn/Titan Quest, though not exactly, and leaves you with a lot of options.  

Boss encounters are designed pretty well; I enjoyed them, just wish there were more.

Difficulty scaling could probably be tweaked.  I started in the middle, jumped to the second difficult around level 20, and by 50 I was playing on legendary after I had gotten some good gear. An ARPG with skills like Grim Dawn and good loot to boot.  Four classes, plenty of different elements, loot seems well designed.  Unfortunately, by the time I started Act Two, I feel I've seen what the game has to offer.  Enter area.  Area is jam packed with monsters, fit in every crevice with no room to breathe.  Use one aoe spell on a group.  They blow up.  3 second cooldown on spell.  Next group.  That's it.  That's what I just did for four hours.

The combat itself is so mind numbingly dull that I'd say it can be compared very decently to Diablo 3.  Giant packs of enemies where you run around, spam abilities to watch trash mobs blow up, and watch random colours appear on the screen as drool slightly drips out the corner of your mouth when your brain turned off.  I'm sure if I stuck it out to endgame that graphical spam would be even worse, which is my attempt to preemptively warn away those who are gonna yell at me for not going to end game.

Read my recommendation as 'neutral'.  Lots of people are into this style of ARPG, and if so, this game is for you.  I hope the devs continue to work on the game as it seems many people enjoy it.  Unfortunately, it is not for me, and four hours is enough.

29225917.review:
像素版D2， 四个职业，每个职业四个天赋，天赋树重做之后可玩性又增加很多，掉落不坑爹，
打击感出色，还有赌博和大秘境，最近又新加了装备强化/洗点系统。

重点说下加点系统，分为天赋树和专精树，二者独立，杀怪升级。天赋树中有很多技能位置
可以多选一，这些技能还可以通过被动强化，所以同一套加点也可以组合出不同玩法。另外
每个主动技能有两个属性，一个是不同天赋（元素），比如火，冰，雷等：另一个是按职业
不同，所有主动技能分为几个大类，比如骑士技能分为剑系，盾系等。技能伤害可以从这两
个属性中增强。每系天赋都可以点出触发其他天赋被动的技能，作者貌似称作协同系统。
每个专精树都是按上述不同属性分成一条直线，被动加强属性。每点天赋或专精又另都加强
对应属性的伤害。

所以如何最佳加点足够你研究很长时间了，洗点基本等于免费，刷腻了换一套天赋接着刷。

暂时没有中文，不过文本量不多，唯一需要的地方就是技能说明，剧情任务啥的砍砍砍
就行了

最后作者在在考虑本地化

28929090.review:
Diamond in the dirt. Amazing game.

Let me start off by saying that me purchasing this game was sheer luck. I caught a streamer that I used to watch playing it and it immediately caught my attention and so I bought it... and boy am I glad that I did! My history with games alike? Well I play this genre quite 'religiously' you can say. I have played them since Diablo 2 first got me hooked to this genre. I have been through the Tochlight's, Grim Dawn, POE, D2-3, Titan Quest, Van Helsings and Victor Vran ect... you name it! And now we can add this gem to the list.

Without any sort of spoilers, I just wanted to create a little list instead of writing heaps of paragraphs.

PRO'S:

-This game pretty much has all that is good in arpg's alike and adds to that list, while leaving out the tedious/bad things. 
-The skill tree's are super CUSTOMIZABLE, have ultimate abilities and masterys! Oh, and respeccs aren't gated nor a pain in the butt like with some other games. 
-The combat is smooth as butter, something I was not expecting from game like this. 
-The loot and itemization is fun and engaging, and you are always excited to find that next upgrade. Furthermore, you will constantly find pieces that cater to other specific build types, so get ready to set pieces aside end game and tinker with them.
-The content is still being updated obviously, but I can tell you that not ONCE was I bored or annoyed by the feel of and act. Other games tend to always have an act or 2 that are just dreadful, well not here!
-The game offers  a lot of Ui customization. So that the user can play how he/she prefers.
-The mobs are pretty engaging, all do different things and the areas are dense.
-Endgame offers 'anomolies' aka endless dungeons, where they progressively get more difficult.
also... music is great, atmosphere is well done and the game has crafting.

Cons:
-UGHH?... oh I guess no MP, but who can complain? It is a costly thing to implement.

There is so much more that I can say, but many others have covered quite a bit of this. I just wanted to further back those comments and this game in particular, because it is truly something special and I cannot wait to see what the future awaits. It is just a shame that only Inidie developers seem to have an ack in knowing how to make games great these days, in this case a super well done hack n slash arpg. This is probably why I have mostly given up on AAA titles.

9/10 Highly Recommend.

28845040.review:
A very engaging, satisfying, and deep hack'n'slash/loot-based ARPG. If you enjoy Diablo-like games and you don't mind the pixelated graphics, it's a really awesome alternative. I typically shy away from indie games, but I can say without a doubt this game gives way more "bang for your buck" than (sadly) a lot of Early Access Steam games nowadays.

* Will run well on most computers.
* Tons of loot. [i]Tons[/i]. Set items, uniques, class-specific, ability-modifying, etc.
* Satisfying spells/abilities that feel weighty when you upgrade them (and get better gear).
* Just updated with huge, customizable skill trees for every class. Just about everything feels viable.
* Updated frequently, with very frequent updates from the developer, as well as community interaction.

The only complaints I could muster, would be that there's a significant amount of loot sorting to deal with. The game has a filter option to prevent tiers of items lower than, say, "rare", tooltips from appearing at least. Also, [b]no online multiplayer[/b]. But that's a small complaint, because I feel like a lot of Early Access games focus way too much on the multiplayer, and everything else suffers.

$10 is a bargain, and $8 (on sale) is a steal, if you really enjoy games like Diablo, Titan Quest, Grim Dawn, Path of Exile, etc.

My only other gripe is that your character doesn't change cosmetically with gear changes, I think that would be SICK if it could be incorporated, as I have already come across some hilarious items within 4 hours of play and looking up to see that I had not stopped since I hit play. This game is fantastic and at ANY discount it's a steal. I got my money's worth upon learning you could get different types of backpacks and I got two uniques within like 20 minutes and like doubled my inventory space. Suddenly every item I found I could make use for by selling and life was great again. Buy this game and support a fantastic developer who is doing it all on his own... You will not regret it! AND THERE'S EVEN MORE TO COME!

28267481.review:
There's a lot to love about Chronicon. Like many other reviews, the comparison to oldschool Diablo is spot-on. Since its early days, a lot's been done to make the combat feel fluid and pleasant, and to add a little bit of variety to the game. On the upside, the game will shower you with loot and you'll never feel like you've been playing forever without changing some of your gear around, and there's never really a dull a moment in the game.
On the downside though, the animations are honestly servicable at best; they aren't /bad/ by any stretch, mind you, but they lack a little bit of fluidity. The game (as of the time of writing) does suffer from a little bit of jerkyness too; picking up currency often creates a really awkward stutter that's kind of hard to look past. Still, all of these things are minor gripes at best, and honestly very easy to look past.
The one thing that really brings the game down for me though, is just how completely overcrowded some of the earlier dungeons feel. Before level 10, you're reusing the same skill or two repeatedly to slowly cleave your way through enemies that are so cramped together, you barely get any time to go through your inventory to look at the loot you picked up. Some folks might enjoy this, but spending 1+ hour on the same dungeon level with 200+ enemies makes progressing through the game feel a little sluggish. Your mileage may vary.

我向制作者反映了两次问题，两次我都收到了回复。这可能是我见过最负责任的开发者了。
我把我之前的评论附在下面，同时大家也可以查看开发者的回应。预祝这个游戏越做越好！

Good Job Devs!
I believe your game will only get better!





之前的评测：

半年前购买了这款游戏，当时觉得完成度太低，所以退款了。但还是留下了好评，因为觉得开发组态度不错，而且游戏潜力很大。
但是时隔半年了，我又重新买了这款游戏，希望看到一些变化，但结果让我非常失望。游戏的完成度依然很低。

我一直喜欢简洁的像素风，但简洁和简陋是有区别的。游戏中人物的动作近乎与无，动画十分僵硬，角色攻击的方向居然是用箭头来显示的，箭头！这是什么年代了？而且不论穿着什么装备，贴图都是一样的。这连当年的暗黑2都不如啊。
同样是像素风，同样是俯视视角，参考一下那个叫做dundeon souls的游戏，区别就立刻体现出来了。看现在的情况，整个美工必须要回炉重造才行。

音乐完全没有任何存在感，也几乎没有变化，玩起来很没有激情。

我挺喜欢这类刷刷刷的arpg的，我知道制作者在游戏性上下了很多功夫，相对于其它类暗黑的arpg，这款游戏的游戏性应该还算不错。但既然我们已经有了恐怖黎明，泰坦之路，火炬之光，维克多弗兰，圣域，流放之路，我为什么还要在这个游戏上花时间刷刷刷呢？它有任何优势吗？除了配置要求低之外，其它的我真的看不到。

28209411.review:
I bought this game for my GPD Win because of its controller support. There aren't many ARPG's like this with xinput support. Sure Grim Dawn has some "meh" controller support, but it never felt right, and made menu navigation feel tedious. Then I saw Chronicon.

I had my doubts. I'm no graphics snob--it wasn't about the pixely style of the game. I'll take gameplay over visuals any day. It was mostly about this being such a little-known indie number. Loot/Grind/LevelUp/Repeat games are simple and addictive to play, but it's a beast to create a well balanced drip-feed of powerful items and rare enemies. Doing it right takes talent. There's no way this dinky little game was going to keep me interested for more than five minutes.

I was wrong.

First off, I've played waaaay more than the steam play record suggests. I've put considerable time in, basically since my GPD Win was first delivered. Chronicon has done more than surpass my expectations. It's one of those few examples of an early access game doing all the right things.

-It's what was promised. It's playable, fun, and scratches the "loot itch."
-Great, clear communication from the developer on what he's working on, and what to expect next.
-I actually find myself feeling excited for new content, rather than vaguely interested.
-Much deeper than it seems. Those first few hours, I was convinced I'd seen the gist of what Chronicon had to offer. There are small puzzles leading to decent gear, procedurally generated "events" and other stuff to shake up the game a little and distract you in between grinding and inventory management. "Yeah, okay, this IS a fun little game, but I don't know if I can play this forev--- OH, DEAR LORD, WHAT IS THAT?! HOLY SHI--"
-I'm not done yet. How am I NOT bored with this game? Sooo many indie and early access games out there and SO few keep my attention. 

I love this game! Keep it coming!

28203822.review:
很不错的暗黑like轻量级游戏；
目前剧情完成了4章，以及有无尽模式。
优点：
1、装备系统（白蓝绿粉红橙），
2、技能系统（每职业有4个技能分支），有洗点药水，不好用马上洗了重新考虑加点；
3、技能Mastery系统（可以强化技能加成），有洗点药水，不好用马上洗了重新考虑加点；
4、附魔系统（能订制装备属性，洗刷刷洗刷刷，洗装备需要刷各种等级材料以及大量的钱）；
5、镶嵌系统（能镶嵌各种宝石，洗刷刷洗刷刷，想要心仪的宝石就靠刷了，刷低级宝石合成更高一级宝石）；
缺点：
1、目前暂时还没有中文，在社区里作者回复说在做完4，5章之后会考虑支持多国语言；
2、作者明确说过本作不会做局域网联机模式；
3、像素画面，对于画面党来说可能很难接受，但是也足够轻量；

25499894.review:
I find myself turning to Chronicon over and over again when I feel like gaming lately and have only been disappointed by the fact that I have reached the end of the existing content (Early Access).  Admittedly, this game caught me a bit off guard.  I hadn't expected that I was going to like it as much as I do.

Having come from recently playing newer aRPG's and some twin-stick shooters, the inability to move and attack at the same time bugged me at first but eventually I adjusted.  Now I don't even really notice it.  One thing I do occasionally get annoyed with is the lack of variation in monster types.  There is some variety between levels but you'll find yourself killing mob after mob of the same few monsters.  There will be variations in their abilities/attacks but if would be nice if there was more diversity in general.  Hopefully that will be improved upon some as the game development continues.

I have not tried the beta versions of the game yet, but from the sounds of it there are MANY improvements including a reworked skill tree and supposedly smoother movement/fighting.  I am looking forward to them being released officially along with the additional chapters.

If you're looking for an inexpensive rpg with nice retro graphics, I highly recommend this one.  For the price, it's hard to beat.

25184443.review:
Esta opinión se basa en la versión EA del juego, en concreto la 0.5.5.2

Chronicon es un Diablo 2 indie. Y, para mi gusto, es el mejor de los de este tipo que he probado hasta el momento. De hecho, lo prefiero con mucho a los Diablos o a los otros clones (PoE, Grim Dawn, etc.) 
Estas son algunas de sus características:

-NO EXISTE MODO ONLINE. No es un juego multijugador masivo -aunque tiene un modo cooperativo para hasta 4 jugadores en el mismo ordenador. Esto, que parece un defecto, seguramente es lo que lo hace tan interesante para mí. Ahora veremos por qué. 
-HAPPY FARMING! Al ser un juego offline, el juego permite farmear objetos con mucha más facilidad. Esto es lógico porque al no existir la posibilidad de comerciar con otros jugadores -la parte para mí más odiosa de estos juegos- tu propio farmeo es el único medio que vas a tener para obtener legendarios, sets. etc. Así que al final es todo menos aburrido: continuamente aparecen objetos interesantes. El tiempo que dedicas en otros juegos a trapichear con cacharros aquí lo inviertes en matar bichos y probar cómo funcionan tus nuevos objetos.
-QUALITY OF LIFE. Otra parte desagradable de los MMORPGs es su aspecto terriblemente competitivo y el afán que tienen los diseñadores por tenerte conectado a sus servidores meses y meses realizando tareas tediosas. Algunos ejemplos:
 -MORIR NO ES TAN GRAVE. En Chronicon, morir apenas causa penalización: pierdes un poco de experiencia y solo pierdes dinero si deseas hacer respawn donde has muerto. Esto último puede solucionarse como en Diablo 2, tomando la precaución de crear portales a la ciudad cuando preveas enfrentamientos peligrosos. Así que no tengas miedo, prueba estrategias nuevas, combinaciones distintas de objetos, zonas aparentemente por encima de tu nivel, etc. Lo peor que puede pasar es que te maten y en Chronicon eso es poca cosa.
 -JUEGA CON LOS SKILLS SIN MIEDO. ¿Cuántas veces has empezado una build y tras 50 horas dedicadas a ella descubres que no es viable porque has derrochado 5 puntos en una habilidad que no servía para nada? En juegos como PoE esto es especialmente grave: intentar crear tu propia build en PoE equivale a ser vapuleado tras los primeros 20 ó 30 niveles: no hay más remedio que consultar guías. Por contra, en Chronicon, basta con comprar una poción muy barata para poder volver a recolocar los puntos como te dé la gana las veces que quieras. Ya no es necesario empezar un nuevo personaje 5 veves para encontrar la build que te gusta. Y no solo puedes ir probando hasta encontrar tu preferida: puedes usar builds específicas para enemigos o zonas específicas, o para objetos o sets de objetos específicos. P. ej: si obtienes un set que duplica el daño de fuego, puedes rentabilizar tu hallazgo elegiendo una build basada en el daño de fuego. 
 -HAPPY FARMING + RESPEC = ENJOY! Éste último es el otro gran motivo por el que farmear en Chronicon no es una tarea estúpida y compulsiva: apretar un botón cien mil veces hasta que salga justo el cacharro que necesitas. Cuando aparece un legendario fantástico pero que no se adapta a tu build ya no tienes que desperdiciarlo vendiéndolo: lo puedes probar y disfrutar cambiando totalmente la rutina de tu estilo de juego.
-SE ACEPTAN SUGERENCIAS. En efecto: otra cosa que me resulta odiosa de los MMORPGs es cuando aparecen los diosecillos anunciando que van a nerfear no sé qué habilidad de los nigromantes o meten un parche que se carga algo que a los jugadores les encantaba y entonces un millón de frikis se disgustan un montón y queman los foros y se lían a tortas con los fanboys hasta que los dioses, a través de un plasma que, al contrario que sus servidores no tiene lag, declaran que la plebe no entiende nada de sus geniales ideas. Chronicon lo ha programado un solo tipo y él mismo pregunta a sus jugadores qué creen que se podría añadir o quitar. Se dirá que eso del buen rollito pasa con todos los juegos indie. Bueno, no con todos ¿eh? Mirad "No man´s sky..." 
-LIGERO Y BONITO. Cada día aborrezco más los juegos que ocupan ochocientos mil gigas y que petan el ordenador de gráficos ultra HD hechos en serie y sin el menor talento artístico. No necesito esa enorme y pesadísima mierda de dinaosaurio en mi disco duro. Chronicon emplea solo 200 mb en divertirme diez veces más de lo que lo hacen PoE o Diablo 3 con 10 gigas.  
-Y ESTO NO ES TODO AMIGOS. Porque cuando escribo esto el juego está en Early Access y con muchas cosas que añadir: nuevos actos y un prometedor sistema en el que será posible adjudicar un número de puntos ilimitado a determinados skills. ¿Os imagináis? "Sí, tengo un warlock de nivel 235.560.442..." 

No he hablado de cosas elementales del juego como que de momento tiene 4 clases jugables, cada una de ellas con cuatro árboles de habilidades, 200 habilidades en total, más de 500 objetos y que técnicamente es muy sólido: jamás he tenido un cuelgue o el más mínimo problema (y repito que es una Early Access.)

En resumen si te gusta jugar a juegos como Diablo pero sin los inconvenientes (y para algunos ventajas) del turbio, hipercompetitivo y aburrido mundo online masivo, tienes que comprar Chronicon. 
Son 10 euros...

25182432.review:
有人说了这游戏有多么好，我也来说说这游戏的槽点吧。
1.奇怪的手感。估计那位给差评的哥们儿也是有一种上当的感觉。
    具体表现
    *人物移动很容易被东西卡住。当人物紧贴着墙面，并且有垂直墙面的移动趋势时，你在沿着墙面的移动速度也会近乎减小至零。
    *有时候人物会卡住，无法移动，但可以做放技能打开背包等操作。
    *当你对着怪物射了一箭时（我目前只玩了弓箭手），如果过快地从怪物方向移开鼠标，箭会射向你鼠标后来所指向的方向。没有试过放技能会不会这样。
    *技能有时候会放不出来，可能是因为过长的硬直时间。我不知道作者是不是打算做一款稍微硬核一些的游戏，但这种手感是不太适合一个砍怪的游戏的。
2.十分普通的游戏性（以暗黑类游戏来说）
    游戏内容，几乎所有东西都是已有的，或者看得出其他游戏影子的，但它是为数不多的像素风暗黑类游戏，也是为数不多的暗黑类像素风游戏——当然，这对我个人来说已经足够了。但要说它游戏性有多高，甚至超越暗黑3和恐怖黎明，实在不敢苟同。
    至于其他好评中的某些特色究竟是不是特色，玩过火炬之光暗黑3恐怖黎明的人心里大概也清楚。
3.背包太小，爆的垃圾太多
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
因为游戏时间不长，很多具体内容和细节就不多说了。
毕竟是还在开发的游戏，有所不足也挺正常。反正也就36块钱，买了也不亏，不爽还可以退。
要说推不推荐，当然是推荐，毕竟也不是所有人都非得要暗黑的手感不可
