24844172.review:
In short, this game is a true gem and I recommend it for any one looking for a hack'n'slash loot fest, a Diablo with a more arcade-like feel to it. I bought it two days ago and I've been in a 3-player coop game with friends 10 hours/day since then. Screw life when you have a source for this much delicious loot!

This is by far the best example of a good Early Access game I've encountered: more than enough content to keep you interested; an already polished look and feel; few, but no serious, bugs (one crash, but the auto-saving meant that no progress was lost). For any of you who played Diablo III from release, Chronicon is currently in the pre-RoS stage, where the player base have an almost complete game, and are essentially testing the class and loot balancing. Unlike Diablo III, that was supposedly complete when it was released (hint: it was not), this Early Access game feels much more complete already, and it will only get better as the developer delivers the promised features.

To the developer: respect for managing to pull this off single-handedly! It is obvious that this is a work of passion.

24835786.review:
I've been playing for a day and half. Up to level 40 now. I think that is well enough to vomit many letters into this tiny box.

Pros:
- Extensive areas
- Items are plentiful. So many variations of suffixes and rarities. 
- You'll get hopelessly addicted as you reminise about your Diablo 2 days.
- Leveling doesn't feel like a chore, it feels just right. 
- Took a peek at the upcoming features and currently in works for this game, looks like the developer has their heart in it to keep fresh content coming. 

Cons:
- This being the main bother: Even though the areas are extensive, there is an extreme lack of mob diversity. It took me an hour and a half to get through a rather large spider cave fighting the same spider model, over and over and over... I wanted it to end so badly but my completionist side wouldn't let me.
- Despite having many skill trees, you only need one skill to endlessly spam to do well on difficulties like Veteran. I like a challenge and you don't really feel tested at all. 
- The music is just mindnumbing. You eventually tune it out as it plays the same for every area throughout the act. Though I suppose if you play with your own in the background, this doesn't really apply to you.

24596857.review:
What I think about Chronicon? I just love it!

This game deserves so much more attention. 
It's a little gem in it's genre and I enjoyed and loved (and still love) every minute of playing.

There are 4 classes, all of which feel different, have their own style and interesting
talent trees, which invite you to experiment with the points spent (there is a a potion,
that let's you reset these points as many times as you need/wish to).
The combat and the killing of things are very satisfying to watch and all of it feels just perfect.
The acts and their levels look very nice and there is much to explore, like hidden quests, rooms, bosses etc,
which I really like to do.

The soundtrack has to be mentioned, too. All pieces of music are great for every environment they are used in,
they manage to create the perfect ambience for every level and act.

It may be still in EA, but there is so much to do, so much loot to find, so many levels to beat etc, that I don't think anyone who plays it, will soon get bored, even if there are some acts and features missing right now.

Besides of that, there is a developer, that really cares about the playerbase and has always an open ear for suggestions you'd like to see in the future.
He seems extremely dedicated to what he's doing here and I think he can surely be proud of this :)

Thanks for reading all of that and as a summary I can just say:
If you have any money to spend and are ony slighty interested in this type of games,
you should buy it.
It's worth every penny (if not more)!

EDIT: I nominated this game in a new category in the Steam Awards for "Best EA Game".
I think it's deserved!

24456627.review:
不错的刷子游戏。基本的割草元素都有，一直想找个像素卡通风格的此类游戏，这次算是满足了。游戏有一定难度，陷阱比较恶心，新手需要多加小心。游戏还是挺耐玩的，你可以把它当做小暗黑来看待。各色装备、天赋、技能、无尽模式都有，角色是比较传统的四大职业，构建角色比较自由。该游戏目前版本已经比较完善了，虽然还有些小问题，但大体是合格的，对得起这个价钱。推荐喜欢刷宝、研究构建角色的休闲玩家一试，相信你不会失望的。

PS：下面写一下个人心得，可以直接跳到更新后部分阅读。

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

（老版本）


玩了40小时，基本玩通了，90级冰弓，补充说说感想。由于只开了三关，感觉游戏内容略少，那个是男人就下一百层的无限模式，个人觉得出装概率也不算高，而且重复装备、垃圾粉太多。30关以后才是噩梦难度，40关以后怪物明显攻击上去了，最烦人的就是自爆型小幽灵，被几个追到围住的话，很难活命（还有恶心的减速和陷阱），好在可以用传送卷回城。这游戏红装实用的不多，攒了几套，发现并没卵用，还是散件搭配来的实惠靠谱。另外，某些小精英怪的粉装是必出的，可以满级后去自行再刷一波，但麻烦的是我没有那么好的记性记得哪里出什么装了= =。另外说说抗性，这游戏的抗性确实难堆，由于别的职业没怎么玩，就说说弓手。弓手的技能面板里只有毒攻击里面有抗性加成，这个推荐点满，对后期很有帮助。装备的话，前期尽量留一些带全抗的首饰和勋章什么的，免得想堆抗性时难堪，因为这游戏抗性装备相对比较难出，或者即便出了也要相应舍掉不少攻击力和血量，怎么取舍就看自己了。弓手的话，前四个难度都没什么威胁，可以一路碾压过去，而且很少反复刷，出什么装备带什么就行了。至于后期玩什么BD还是要看你有什么装备，毕竟这游戏可以无限洗点，所以不用考虑职业成型问题，随时洗了就是了。   （目前已经满级了，无尽塔第一次貌似有45层，第二次重新打打倒70层还没结束，50关以后难度变成神话模式，感觉没比噩梦难多少，掉宝率有500+，但是掉率依旧坑爹。攒了套冰弓红字专属装备，属性不错，感觉已经刷不出什么了，通关没见到橙色装备，貌似只有满级后打无尽才出，属性不错但和红字装备位置重复，总的来说还是不如红字。）

最后，还是希望能早点玩到新内容，尤其是之前提到的类似星座天赋之类的内容，希望制作组能加油，感谢能做出这么不错的游戏。

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

（更新后）


最近发现更新回来玩玩，有了游侠网汉化方便很多，目前已经刷了神话300层，还不知道啥时候是个尽头，简单说说心得。这个版本的冰弓依旧给力，雪暴套伤害很好，配合3个冰弓主力技能几乎是无间断控场、伤害也基本碾压怪物，所以输出是不愁的，这游戏要想打后期，满抗性是必须的，就算不满也要常年全抗保持在60-70%以上，才可以勉强保证安全，如果装备实在不好可以优先加火抗和毒抗，因为这两种属性抗是最重要的，其次是电抗和冰抗，最后是另外两种抗，物理抗性对弓手来说相对不那么重要，60%左右即可。血量，差不多15000左右够了，要能顶住一套弹力炸弹（火）和小鬼的毒弹就行。回血方面主要靠击回，有140左右的击中回血就够，当然对冰弓来说他的射程不是很远，回血是越多越好，能达到210更理想。暴击，冰弓不太依赖暴击，但也不能太低，毕竟这游戏到后期暴击还是很提高效率的，要想刷图快暴击率至少50%，暴伤300左右。移动，这个150左右就可以了，没必要把珍贵的装备词条浪费在这上面，点点被动技能就差不多了。掉宝率，这个其实不用堆，刷图本身的掉宝率就够了，不堆不是不想用，而是实在没空堆它，我之前强化的掉宝率词条装备到后期基本都废了，没抗性和血量还是没用的，不如堆后者。

再说说电弓，目前从我玩的电精灵套装电弓来看，输出非常可观，效率甚至比风暴冰弓还要迅猛，不过精灵毕竟是召唤物，容易挂掉，影响一些秒输出，但总的来说还是靠谱的。安逸度上没冰弓理想，但是爆发强一些，BD可以走电精+电弧，这套基本可以毕业了，总的来说弓手这职业还是冰弓和电弓略给力一点，至于毒弓确实挺耐打，但是输出节奏太慢了，清怪不效率，可以辅修。（这里要特别说明，电弧这个技能目前版本很容易卡死机，慎玩电弓）

另外提一下物弓，这个版本的物弓有所加强，普攻射程远，二连发套装很过瘾，输出给力安全回血快，唯一不好的就是控场不行、刷群怪效率也差一些，总体来说不如冰弓电弓。

弓手升级总的来说比较安全，刷图效率很高，只要稍微留意下弹力炸弹和连发电圈、火陨石就可以了，只有这三种攻击技能秒人概率很大，毒炮也能秒人不过后期装备上去了也就不怎么疼了，当然偶尔被秒也是正常的。这游戏传奇300层左右也算基本到头，再往后的难度只是单纯刷宝升级、抗性不会减少了（300层前每下一层减少1点抗性），也就是说难度基本停滞了，打不出什么新鲜装备，后面的层数只是增加怪物伤害、掉宝率和升级率。

弓手毕业的标配：一身红字技能套装+疾驰鞋子+加持首饰套+生命注射器(回血实际效果一般可替换)。人物血量 1.3w  -  1.5w 左右，回避24-30左右越高越好(回避效果还是很明显的)，伤害8000左右，暴击至少70以上越高越好，暴伤300左右，全抗80满，移动150，这样就差不多了，当然我说的是标配，具体还要看BD和装备而定。目前没觉得真传奇衣服和头有比红字收益好的，有待观察。

FINALLY! A game that I have been LOOKING for!! You have no idea how long I've been waiting for something like this, and looking. Few games have scratched that itch I needed. If you love Diablo-esque playstyle, then this is the game for you. You can pick from 4 classes - Paladin, Berserker (my choice), Ranger, and Warlock. Each have 4 skill tree types you can build on and have the character you want. The customization is non-existant, you don't get to pick how your character looks, and from what I've seen so far, you keep the same skin. This is a bit dissapointing, I was hoping to at least see the equipment I pick up, at least to SOME extent. But, that's a minor issue. 

A worthy buy, and well worth the price it's going for. It's still in early access so you never know what they'll add later. I'm hoping to see SOME skin changes, or equipment skin added where you can see what you picked it and feel a bit more accomplished rather than look the same way from level 1 to end game.

Love at first sight, is how I describe the small amount of time I spent, thus far on this little gem. My favorite genre in gaming has always been ARPG's so I have quite a bit of experience playing all the major ones. But none has capture the love I had for Diablo I & II as well as this game.

Everything is spot on like Loot, Diablo style enemie mods, Random dungeons. Everything is amazing. 

EXCEPT...

Combat... 

Not being able to MOVE + ATTACK at the same time feels so out of place and clunky that i literally cant even lol.

a lot of your abilities stem from aoe and grouping up mobs and burning them down. I started out doing fine but i beat the areas without leveling enough i guess because rounding up enemies became impossible at level 9 and i wasnt able to kill hardly anything because in order to attack i had to be in melee range. and then they were all attacking me.. and in the area i was in which was the only area left to go they would kill me in the time it took my potion to recharge.

I ended up refunding this title becuase of the poor character movement and mostly because of the GUI fails. 
I played this on my couch on my 4k TV and regardless of item scaling through windows and GUI scaling in the game (which didnt seem to change at all no matter what i put it on) the Hud Elements were so small that i could not even come close to seeing them. basically like a 3in wide by 2 in tall character HUD on a 60 in 4k tv from 9 feet away just isnt going to work lol.

23696638.review:
I had a dream, that one day I would make a kick-ass aRPG in the spirit of Diablo but with pixel graphics.
Then I found Chronicon, and cried many different tears. Tears of joy that I had found exactly what I was looking for, tears of frustration that I didn't get to make the game, and tears of ...more... joy... joyful tears lots of joy and tears... and...
Okay enough onto the review.

This game is spectacular!
In scope, character builds, and OMG moments, both in frustration because of the difficulty and pure awe of the carnage and destruction.

This is not just your average Pixel aRPG - the sound is great, the pixel art is amazing, the boss fights are fun, and it has so many great things going for it's gameplay I don't know where to begin.

The control scheme works very well, weather you want to use a controller or you want to use keyboard and mouse...

hold on... chicken patties are done...
Thank's for waiting.

The loot drops are fun, and seem right on par with a diablo 3 as far as quality items dropping requent enough to enjoy the tons of loot that does drop.

There are additional portals that can spawn sometimes that take you to challenge areas such as an arena with waves of monsters, or an area with magical monsters that all have a global mod added onto them.

The progression is non-nonsense, you will be killing monsters 95% of the time, and the rest of the time you are back in town selling loot.

The 'town' is an efficiently layed out space that has the NPCs close by and the teleportation pad close by as well.
Almost evey level in a given 'Act' has a waypoint. So there is really not a lot of needless running around.

I have not played with friends, but I imagine it would be just as fun as any other aRPG is with friends.

All highlight points aside, if you are looking for a pixel art aRPG similar to Diablo, then just buy this right now, it is completely worth the full price, and if you see it on sale there should be no question at all.
It is so satisfying on so many levels it is hard to put into words.

I know you're reading this to see if you should buy it, so I'll cut to the chase.

Yes, buy it.

Now, if you're like me and see reviews like this and go "ok, but why?" then, continue on.

The gameplay is fast, tight, and fun as hell.  All classes are viable, feel different to play, and most importantly, are fun to play.  I honestly didn't pay too much attention to the story, so I cant comment on the quality of it, but all you need to know is that there's a bunch of stuff that doesn't like you, and you don't like it.

The dev cares deeply about the game, constantly takes feedback from the community, actually puts that feedback into the game, and he updates often.

So, if you liked any of the diablos, torchlights, victor vran, starcraft/dota adventure customs, hero siege, MU online, or any other awesome loot-grindy, hacky-slashy, pew pew, check-out-my-sweet-new-build, games, then seriously, buy this one, too.

23383496.review:
Without a ton of hours put into this game, there's a few things I can tell you. 

Firstly, if you're a fan of Diabloesque gameplay, Chronicon has got it. If you're into Indie games and the fresh perspective they bring, you'll like what you see. If you enjoy refreshingly lo-fi graphics that invoke the feeling of nostalgia, then you'll need to look no further. If seek an experience that constantly beckons you back for more, you'll be hooked. If you like loot, and lots of it, you'll have more than you need. If you find yourself attracted to Mobs, you'll be in good company. If you need a new RPG to scratch that fantasy itch, you'll find relief here. If you dig games that don't take themselves too seriously, the gameplay will put you at ease. Lastly, if you want mechanics that don't get in the way of fun, Chronicon will deliver it.

So yeah, give it a try. The price is right and if you hit on more than one item I touched on above, you surely won't regret it!

23274701.review:
While still in early access this game is nice hack'n'slack RPG that will satisfy your loot itch. The art style while definitely unique, it kinda feels a bit too simplistic for my taste but that doesn't take away from the fun. There's 3 Acts completed by the time of this review and the developer updates quite frequently with content and general fixes, there's 2 more acts in the works from what it seems which is quite exciting!

The combat might feel stiff at times but there's nothing too serious to hinder the player. There's lots of dungeons to explore, quests and optional quests, a quite decent story to unravel and the gear system is top notch. Legendaries, sets, you name it. There are several classes to choose from, each one with own specific talent tree and an important note is that you can actually change your talents at your leisure for dirt cheap.

There's some endgame content in the form of Anomalies (think of Diablo III rifts) and quite a few secrets within the main campaign.

Overall this is a very promising game, sort of like a diamond in the rough, quite worth its price compared to the hours of content provided, and there's replayability with playing different classes and doing anomalies. The game also supports local co-op however I did not had the chance to give it a go.

Recommended for experienced ARPG fans and even more so for those who might be new to genre.

23108264.review:
20Lvまでやってみての感想。
クラスはテンプラー（近接盾）、バーサーカー（格闘）、ウォーデン（弓）、ウォーロック（杖）の4種類ある。
クラスによって扱える属性が異なり、スキルツリーも属性によって異なる。

難易度はカジュアル、ノーマル、ベテラン、ヒロイック、レジェンダリーの5種類で、Lv1の状態からいつでも難易度を選べる。
難易度によってドロップ率や経験値、クリスタル（お金）、耐性の減少値、レジェ装備のドロップ有無が異なる。
マルチプレイも出来るがオンラインでは不可能。ローカルマルチのみ。

インベントリは最初は狭いが、バッグを入手する事により持てる容量が増える。バッグのみ難易度ノーマルでもレジェンダリー（12枠増加）のドロップ確認済み（カジュアルでドロップするかは不明）。バッグは装備枠２つあるので最大２４枠増加できる。

倉庫はキャラ別の倉庫と共有倉庫がある。
共有倉庫のみクリスタルを払うことで拡張可能。

操作方法はWASD移動、クリックで通常攻撃。
スキルはスキル画面でアイコン右クリックする事により割り当て可能。（1PデフォルトはLMB、RMB、1、2、3、4キー）
ゲームパッド使用可。

ダンジョン内ではちょっとしたパズルがあったり（例えばルービックキューブの1面だけを完成させると特別なユニーク装備がもらえたりする。）、敵を倒すと稀にゲートが発生し、modが付いたマップに入れたりする。
[strike]まだAct1のクリアはしていないが、ダンジョン内は全体的に暗く、同じような構造がずっと続いている。[/strike]敵やトラップ、隠し部屋のスイッチが見辛いのが難点。透明の敵やコウモリなんかはマジで見辛い。
Act2は森林地帯で難度が増した。遠距離系の敵がウヨウヨ居て、近づいてもバックステップされて追わなきゃいけないのが近接だと難儀。この辺りから装備で一定確率で発動するスキルが強く感じてきた。
死亡した時はクリスタルを支払えばその場で復活できたりもする。

拠点にはクリスタルでの装備別のギャンブルもある。

980円でこれだけ出来れば安い買い物だけど、オンラインマルチが無いので友達とワイワイしたい人は家に招くしかない。
ぼっちプレイの俺は割りと楽しめてます。ドット絵もいい感じです。
ディアブロやPoEなんかにちょっと飽きたらこれで遊ぶのも有りだと思います。お勧め。

22635274.review:
My first review on Steam.

If you like Diablo 2 you will feel right at home with Chronicon. 
Seriously, this game only gets better the more you play and the developer (yes, this is a ONE person made game) spews out updates like there’s no tomorrow. It´s a Hacknslash ARGP with tons of loot and randomization.
Act 3 is being worked on & A4 + A5 are coming. Even in this early state the game is amazingly fun. 
Four classes might sound little but each has 4 different build trees, There are 100 levels available and more classes will eventually get released once the game goes live.
This is the story of how a 1-person indie developer can do better games than multimillion dollar companies. It´s David vs. Goliath and it´s all about passion. The itemzation alone is better than anything I’ve seen since D2. Yes, it´s not that pretty and yes it is old school 8-bit graphics - if Virtual Eye Candy is a must look elsewhere. For those who can accept lesser graphics for better game quality think Gauntlet meets Diablo 2 and immensely addictive. 
Even the pricing is ridiculously low. 10 bucks? I threw more than double the price amount on donations alone just to get this going.


Cons 
The build trees themselves could use more diversity
No online play 
8 bit graphics
Needs more advertisement (WAKE UP Total Biscuit, Angry Joe, ReformistTM, Quill18 and all the others)

Pros
Old school ARGP at its finest
The developer clearly shows a lot of passion and it easy to get smitten
Keyboard or gamepad - your choice
Up to 4 Players on one machine with gamepads
Random maps
Quests
100 Class and skill point levels
Five difficulties (you choose difficulty each new session)
No-return portals with random zone affixes
Cheap Skill-reset potions 
Legendary loot can drop from the get go
Shrines that yield buffs
Riddles yielding extra loot when solved
10 bucks
Tons of customization in the options menu
10 bucks
4 Trees with overlapping mechanics for each class
10 bucks
Champions & Bosses with random affixes
Did I mention it only costs 10 bucks?

22614166.review:
2016.5.21更新  游戏时间：30小时

这次更新评测主要就是说下游戏新版本的内容，想看游戏基本内容的看分割线以下就好。
官方在5月20号终于更新了游戏内容而不是fixbug或是简单的加点装备之类的。
加入了无限地牢模式。官方自己取了个名字叫Anomiles（似乎是这个，反正就是跟章节传送点旁边的小飞龙说句话他就会帮你打开了。）
这个模式的机制就是随即地图，随即怪物，由易到难。
每三层会出一个boss，打死boss继续下一层。
难度划分是前6关是normal，7到未知是verterian（我现在在第十层还是老兵），总之就是越来越难。我被第十层的反伤精英搞死了，就退出游戏了。
然后打死boss会出个箱子。地牢难度和你正常游戏难度选取无关。其实说白了就有点像暗黑3的大密境。
掉率的话感觉是normal时候的层数不掉红装，verterian的层数开始掉红装。

我不得不说这个模式引入真心比新剧情要好。因为通关剧情（前三章）后，想刷等级和装备，但是一直找不到特别好刷的图，这个模式怪特别多，经验特别高。
我进去时候84级，打到第十层已经88级了。5粉装1红装的节奏。因为前面normal难度的层数基本是秒杀（除了boss），所以还挺快的。

所以大家又能刷起来了。

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
玩了15个小时了.好玩儿到根本停不下来
可以负责的告诉你，假如你喜欢Diablo-like的ARPG，这款游戏绝对不容错过。
真心是近几年来最赞的一款类暗黑游戏了。
虽然画风是像素风，还是2D的，但是游戏性超高，我觉得超越了暗黑3太多。
其实前段时间大家都在争论恐怖黎明和暗黑3到底谁更好。
但我现在想说，都给Chronicon让到一边去。


目前玩到73级了。5个难度，前两个不掉传奇（红装），第三个老兵模式开始有机率掉红装，说实话我觉得把控的挺好，不是很容易获取又不是暗黑3 v1.08时候难如上天的感觉。
装备分白色普通、蓝色精良、紫色优秀、粉色精华（可出套装）、红色传奇。
而老兵模式就是如果脸不够白，装备不能实时跟上，就很容易吃力，这时候去第二个难度划下水刷点装备升升级，很快就能回第三个难度。毕竟红装更厉害。
后面2个模式，第四个是Herotic（英雄难度），掉率更高，开始有惩罚了，所有抗性减10%，但是我63级时候一身同等级粉装或者红装去英雄难度基本没有压力。最后一个模式还没试，因为怪物血量500%，攻击力150%，而且精英数量似乎加倍刷新了，减抗20%，这游戏堆抗不容易，所以这减的挺伤的，所以还是想等满级再挑战。


然后游戏5个章节，每个章节内容4-5个小时吧，我觉得2D的算超长了，我自己属于强迫症，基本上是全扫荡，有几个地图超大，各种支线地图，刷怪刷精英刷boos，非常爽。
（73级通关后补充下，目前Early Access只开通前三个章节。后面2个等制作组更新吧。）
说下这游戏有个特色地图，叫做随机地图，类似火炬之光2的相位门，但是没有指定的怪，任意的怪死亡都有几率开启这个随机地图。
游戏怪分4种，普通怪，小精英（一个皇冠标注，相当于暗黑3里的蓝精英，以组为单位，每组小精英3-8个左右，每个精英独立掉落），大精英（三个皇冠标注，相当于暗黑3里的黄精英，以一个为单位，通常拥有多项技能），boss（一般，血是绿色的，没有皇冠标注，不会提示有什么技能，但会更频繁的使用技能）。
随机地图里只有小精英，需要提醒的是随机地图不能回城，所以一旦出了随机地图，先开个传送回家把背包清空，因为一般一场随机地图可以收获很多，免得到时候出现背包满了取舍的尴尬。屏幕右上角会标注这个随机地图的怪共有什么属性，我随便写几个我常见的：比如自愈功能，隐匿，一下想不起来了，但是有一个我必须要说，叫做Treasurer，也就是宝藏携带者。假如你遇到这个属性我只能告诉你3个字：你要发。就是每个怪的掉宝率增加了好多好多倍，基本上老兵难度一次，2-3件红装，5-10件粉装。真心超级爽。


虽然没有中文吧，但是剧情可以以前慢慢补，毕竟4个职业，每个刷到100级，感觉汉化就出来了。哈哈。
游戏虽说看上去很简陋，但是你玩了会发现制作组很用心。打击感也是实打实的有，通过不同的音效，技能以及暴击，你一听就知道，也能感受得到。
每个职业4个系列技能（每个系列6-7个主动，3-4个被动的样子，技能框只能放6个主动），随你喜好搭配，目前不知道这个游戏存不存在BD的设定。目前应该是没有，高难度可能有。


这游戏差不多这个样子。最后总结下。
游戏真的有魔性。掉率高，但不至于满地都是。
基本上过几分钟让你有一种惊喜的感觉。刷子游戏最需要的不也就是这样刷刷刷下去的动力么。
游戏素质也不错。就希望以后能出联机，那就超级赞。目前有本地多人。可以和基友一起耍。
游戏还有一些地图致敬了暗黑2，比如暗黑2的奶牛关，这游戏有个彩虹独角兽关。
总之，这游戏在我看来就是2D版的真正的大菠萝3。


别犹豫了，快来一起刷刷刷。

Wow, this is a seriously fun loot filled RPG, and its so cheap.

I have tried most new loot fest type RPG's that have a similar play style to Diablo/TQ over the last couple of years and this game is one of the most fun out of the whole lot. Chronicon just gets things it so right.

The current video (Updte 0.40.0) really does well to show what this game is capable of and how you can take your champ/build too amazing heights.

The upcoming changes in update 0.50.0 just make this game even more worth while, with even more gear slots/options and in turn more ability to play with getting your stats setup just right.

Sure the skill tree is no where near as complex as PoE and the visuals are not as nice as D3, but so far this game is an epic 10/10 and shines bright alongside much bigger titles, and there is still more to come from a really friendly and active Developer. I onlyhave two gripes about the game so far:
- Can't move and attack at the same time (This may be a good thing)
- Very limited multiplayer

TLDR: Really fun loot filled RPG, worth far more than it costs. 10/10.

21096663.review:
Chronicon is the dungeon crawler I've been waiting my whole life for.

Pros:
-Tons of loot!
-Ultra-rare items make a very distinct noise when dropped, you will always notice them.
-Four classes to choose from.
-Each class has four skill trees, so there are plenty of ways to build them.
-Characters can be easily respecced and renamed.
-Plenty of item effects to help build your character (+poison damage, thorns, spell casts on hit, magic find, etc.)
-5 difficulty settings.
-Level ups happen often enough that your character always feels like it's progressing.
-Attractive pixel art. It's easy to make out what's happening even when things get crowded.

Cons:
-[strike]I wish I could adjust the map's opacity.[/strike] (whoops, I didn't look hard enough)
-The skill trees could use a little more variety.

21093596.review:
Action rpg's are my life blood. I love the loot pops, and the color coding and the whole hamster wheel. This game takes a lot of elements wholesale from diablo games. And it's often better off for it. I was shocked that a game that looked like this could literally be such a worthy contender in the genre.

Unfrotunately, I would rank this below such games as grim dawn, diablo 2, diablo 3, and even sacred 2. Some things about this game, despite having a ABSOLUTE TON of great content, are asthetic. The art style frustrates me. The sound effects lack any kind of crunch or grit. They all fall completely flat. And hitting enemies results in no explosion of bones or gibs or anything. It's just a sprite change from alive to dead. 

A game like this needs crunchy impact. And right now , if i start a new game with a magic caster. Every single attack sound will irritate me. I could literally open up a free sound deposit website and find something better than the default attack sound. The visuals also lack that same gravity, they don't have to be 3d or gothic. If you want to use 2d lowbit sprites go ahead, just make them attractive.

Finally, the game itself has a lot of systems. And most of them, including combos, enchanting, skill trees, and loot stats are all quite good. The loot drop rate however is far too high. You go strait out the first gate in the game and it's nothing but blues. I think that needs to be inverted. Completely reverse the drop rate. And make a colored item, you know, rare. Make whites mostly drop. 

Now, in order for this to work, you need to make the core combat without stats be crunchy. The entire reason why I think you have stats right away is because the raw combat never feels crunchy or satisfying. Make the core combat have crunch, sound plays a big role. Visuals and feedback and explosions play another role. You want the game to have a flow. to be quick and responsive, and to really focus on satisfying collision in all respects. - I know. It's very hard to get that right. But it's the most important thing. Go back. Fix that. Take that loot drop rate right down. Then let's see. For now it's merely a good game. I want it to become a great one.

21079953.review:
As it stands right now: 
Early Access
Version: 0.43.2

The game is quite fun with hints of gauntlet, realm of the mad god, and wayward souls.

Game essentials you should know:
*there are 5 "zones" similar to gauntlet games, however each one branches into dozens of subzones WITHIN the main level each escalating in difficulty
*there are 5 different difficulty settings at the start, along with 4 classes, all of which are drasticly different
*the game holds your hand for the first hour or so of the first dungeon then enemies seriously beef up on damage and health, you either have 50 health potions sitting around doing nothing or none and desperately needing one
*Enemies spawn in clusters with the "follow the brain" zombie AI, typical of hack and slashes (this isn bad)
*Bosses are great and so are mini-bosses
*multiplayer is very fun especially at higher difficulty settings
*The game is a giant loot hunt like borderlands (theres so much youll really have to choose what suits you!)
*the skill tress are GREAT and well balanced
*combat is STAND AND CAST (maybe we will see this change but even so the game is great fun!)
---Cant wait to see more classes!-----

A fun gem at a fair price, deffinitly for fans of the hack n' slash dungeon crawler genre

20471739.review:
Early Access Review

Well, early days yet for this game, and it's made by one guy, though despite this it shows much promise. However, I give it my recommendation because of this, and in spite of it's various flaws.

The skill system could use some work. A lot of it is cookie-cutter. Main Skill + Mana Reducing effect. I am not exageratting when I say every class follows this path, so the early hours of the game are mainly spamming a single skill. And why do I need to dump 10 skill points into that skill for it be usable? I should be spending those points on getting new abilities which will vary the game play.

The combat, outside of character building, is simple, but satisfying. Screen shakes, enemies explode all over the place, kill chains keep you moving (would love the timer bar from D3 in there!). That's all good stuff.

The itemization is also fairly solid, with some neat items to find, and while nothing mind blowing or game changing, there is a certain level of character customization to be found in what gear you decide to wear. Healing vs. Damage vs. Utility. 

I give it a tentative recommendation. I will probably keep an eye out and keep playing, but hopefully over time, the skill system could get a closer look to enable more varied combat between classes and skill trees.

There is some stiff competition in terms of ARPGs these days, and even a tiny indie project must consider that, because you're fighting for that time. I would like to see this game do things a little differently, offer something fresh, as opposed to the same things found in AAA ARPGs, but at a smaller and pixelated scale.

6/10 Not terrible.

19790736.review:
A fun action rpg of the Diablo/Torchlight variety with nostalgic graphics, random dungeons, lots of loot, and 4 distinct classes. Slightly clunky, but very well-developed for an early access title.

For maximum enjoyment: use a controller, turn up the ambient light in the settings, find a big screen, and invite three friends with three more controllers.

Edit: Having now played Chronicon for over 60 hours and reached level cap, I thought it worthwhile to expand this review.

Chronicon is easily one of the best Early Access titles I've played. The game is well balanced, the classes are already fleshed-out (with 4 skills trees each and plenty of legendaries to enhance each tree), and the level design is random enough that there's always an element of uncertainty (although the very small maps tend to just juggle around enemy variety and placement). The game has pretty solid controller support for both XBox 360 and Steam Controller; I mostly play with the latter.

The local co-op is one of Chronicon's strongest features. I've played a few hours with my brother and my girlfriend and it's a really enjoyable and straighforward experience. Just plug in another controller and go. Be prepared to spend a fair bit of downtown sorting through loot, though.

The updates have been very regular and significant so far. I worry about the amount of sleep the dev is getting. Bug fixes come very quickly and I haven't yet encountered a bug that ruined the game or cost me significant progress.

The plot isn't particularly rivetting, but I've never played an ARPG with an even remotely engaging plot, so this doesn't bother me. We're all here to kill monsters, after all, not read walls of text. And Chronicon's monster-slaying is highly satisfying. This is a game where you butcher hundreds of enemies in one go. The game includes a killstreak mechanic similar to D3's, except in Chronicon you'll quickly find yourself bringing in killstreaks that break 100. On higher levels, you'll find yourself getting closer to 1000.

I highly recommend Chronicon, especially if you're a fan of loot-heavy, dungeon crawling action rpgs but miss the controller support of older console titles like Dark Alliance and Champions of Norrath.

19762082.review:
[b][i]Chronicon[/i] is essentially an indie version of [i]Diablo[/i], and I really like it.[/b] You can play up to four players local (no online), which really spices things up with a game like this. I was never too keen on [i]Diablo[/i], but this I can get into - especially with a friend or two.

[i]If you are not familiar with the [i]Diablo[/i] series or type of gameplay, it basically consists of action-based hack-n-slash dungeon crawling to 1) gain experience, and 2) pick up loot, which is hopefully better than what you have. Then you return to a main hub or town to manage your stuff and level up. Rinse and repeat. Its a simple formula, but can be quite addictive and really offer tons of replayability, especially considering different hero classes.[/i]

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Graphics are nice
+Up to four players local
+Full controller support
+Totally cheap for the amount of replayability
+Lots of great in-game options for things like map placement/opacity, text size, lighting options, and tons more - I really appreciate this for a game that you can play from the couch with four people (in the past, there are a few games that would have been totally great if it weren't for limited options like this)

[b]Meh:[/b]
=Music is decent so far

[b]Cons:[/b]
-We need to get more people following this game - the community is super small
-Its not done yet - which is almost never a 'Con' for me, but its one guy and I just really hope this title gets finished to the point of the original vision.

[b]Yeah, if you like [i]Diablo[/i] and you like indie games - this is totally worth full price, IMO.[/b]

17370572.review:
Well there isn't really much else to say that the other reviews haven't already said, but I will say that the game is very good. It's well made, with very good gameplay mechanics and surprisingly a lot to do. There isn't as much content as I would like, as of writing this review there is currently only 1 act available. However, don't let that fool you as there is a lot of content packed into the act, plus there are something like 5 different difficulties to choose from (though they dont really change things much). 

The maps are giant, to do a full clear of a map will likely take at least an hour if not more to complete. There are tons of enemies and various enemy modifiers that can make enemies different, like speed modifiers and element modifiers. There are secret rooms packed with treasures, there are tons of items to find, with lots of various stats. There are currently 4 classes (a paladin (template), warrior (beserker), hunter (warden), mage (warlock)). Each class has 3 skill paths, 2 paths for active skills and 1 path for passive skills. Each class can have a total of 3 active skills at once, with the ability to reset your skills from a potion within town. Each skill can be upgraded a total of 10 times. There are pets and minions as well.

As it stands the game is really good, I can't wait for more content and updates. Something else worth noting is that the developer is very involved, posting and helping in the forums to every question asked so far. I really hope the game succeeds as i would love to see this game fully developed.
